If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will and gains drain life and wraith spawn.

Dream Spider.name: Dream Spider
Dream Spider.publicNotes:
A dream spider's webs have an iridescent hue and are infused with the same hallucinogenic compound as the creature's toxin. Originally denizens of tropical jungles, dream spiders have adapted well to temperate environments, particularly thriving among the rooftops of cities where shady alchemists use their venom to produce the drug known as shiver.

Spiders range dramatically in size, yet all are to some extent venomous.

TFsDNtIHhwteQUz9.name: Web Sense
TFsDNtIHhwteQUz9.description: The dream spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

bR7DFykvg3BJRRmV.name: Dream Spider Venom
bR7DFykvg3BJRRmV.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} plus stupefied 1 (1 round)

Q7cHvTaIWyRwhMYl.name: Web Trap
Q7cHvTaIWyRwhMYl.description: A creature hit by the dream spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 16).

Dust Mephit.name: Dust Mephit
Dust Mephit.publicNotes:
Whining and self-important creatures, dust mephits are known for their tendency to pronounce doom and gloom at every opportunity, lamenting every insignificant and minor difficulty as though it were an insurmountable obstacle and making themselves out to be heroes for struggling valiantly against their cruel fates. They tend to be thin and gaunt, with dusky brown and gray skin and wings.

Mephits are small, weak creatures that serve at the whims of other elemental entities. The mephits presented here are less common than air mephits, earth mephits, and the like, as they are a blend of two different elements rather than focusing on one alone.

3t3ulXs6r1EL76F0.name: Breath Weapon
3t3ulXs6r1EL76F0.description:
The dust mephit breathes a cloud of dust in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {2d6}[slashing]]]{2d6 slashing damage} to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The dust mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dweomercat.name: Dweomercat
Dweomercat.publicNotes: Dweomercats are magically gifted felines from the First World, where they prey upon other creatures and feed upon their primal energy. They are sometimes encountered in areas of the Material Plane where the veil to the First World is thin, or in regions where magic has been irreparably warped. Dweomercats are famous for their ability to twist the metaphorical strings of spells cast on or near them, which they can transform into their own defensive magic or tap into to instantly teleport across the battlefield.
Dweomercat.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

zSdkC5bHVECvhK79.name: 解除魔法(随意施法) Dispel Magic (At will)
zSdkC5bHVECvhK79.description: 你干扰法术或者效果中的魔法力量。尝试一次反制检定，对抗目标。如果你成功对抗一个法术效果，你将其反制。如果你成功对抗一个魔法物品，该物品成为该类型的普通物品，持续10分钟。这不会改变物体的非魔法性质。如果目标是一件神器或者类似的物品，你自动失败。

sinEXpm7xMjuylIj.name: 侦测魔法(恒定法术) Detect Magic (Constant)
sinEXpm7xMjuylIj.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

SaVJfclmAsjFCBke.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

GVP9BghiDShSeHpL.name: Alter Dweomer
GVP9BghiDShSeHpL.description:
Trigger The dweomercat is targeted by a spell or is within the area of a spell as it is cast

Effect The dweomercat gains an effect related to the school of the triggering spell. This effect occurs before the dweomercat is affected by the triggering spell. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until the dweomercat uses this ability again, or until the dweomercat Dismisses the effect, whichever comes first.

  • Abjuration The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to AC.
  • Conjuration A cloud of fog appears in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] centered on a corner of the dweomercat's space. Anything in the cloud is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.
  • Divination The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks.
  • Enchantment The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all saves.
  • Evocation Magical feedback deals [[/r {4d6}[force]]]{4d6 force damage} to the triggering spellcaster (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save).
  • Illusion The dweomercat becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This effect ends if the dweomercat uses a hostile action, in addition to the normal end conditions.
  • Necromancy The dweomercat gains 10 temporary HP.
  • Transmutation The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all attack rolls.

nrHgXy7XizFWsPFe.name: Dweomer Leap
nrHgXy7XizFWsPFe.description:
Prerequisites The dweomercat has at least one @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door} spell remaining

Effect The dweomercat casts dimension door, then can make a melee Strike against one creature adjacent to it at the end of its teleport. If the dweomercat ends its teleport adjacent to a creature under an ongoing spell effect or who cast a spell since the dweomercat's last turn, this does not expend a casting of dimension door.

s9Def6M7z5ceOIoj.name: Pounce
s9Def6M7z5ceOIoj.description: The dweomercat Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the dweomercat began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Earthen Destrier.name: Earthen Destrier
Earthen Destrier.publicNotes: This wave of dirt takes the crude likeness of the melded forequarters of a charging warhorse and a rocky knight wielding a rudimentary lance of gray stone.

eIV0ZcgzUZI0e8VM.name: Earth Glide
eIV0ZcgzUZI0e8VM.description: An earthen destrier can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

st5T6nXfjzQXbUOB.name: Lancing Charge
st5T6nXfjzQXbUOB.description: If the destrier moved at least 10 feet directly before its lance arm Strike, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its damage roll.

AKHyZQZIqFBrYLLC.name: Tilting Strike
AKHyZQZIqFBrYLLC.description:
Trigger The earthen destrier tramples a creature

Effect The earthen destrier makes a lance arm Strike against the creature it's trampling at a -5 penalty.

Elasmosaurus.name: Elasmosaurus
Elasmosaurus.publicNotes:
Elasmosauruses are long-necked, primeval reptiles that dwell in deep oceans and seas. Although not truly a dinosaur, elasmosauruses are often found in similar locations and are similarly titanic creatures. Keeping their massive bodies underwater, elasmosauruses use their long necks to catch prey and snorkel air to their massive lungs while remaining mostly hidden from the surface above. An elasmosaurus is 30 feet long and weighs 6,000 pounds.

As rare and reclusive as they are, elasmosauruses are sometimes mistaken for even rarer creatures called water orms, legendary aquatic denizens of remote lakes known for their elusiveness and craftiness. Whereas elasmosauruses are mundane creatures of animalistic intelligence, water orms are magical beings with near-humanoid intelligence and a curious fascination with mortals, and they seem to delight in confounding onlookers. As a result, it's theorized that a typical water orm is more than happy to lead a group of spectators to a lost elasmosaurus, both to throw its pursuers off its tail and for the hilarity that will inevitably ensue.

While elasmosauruses are often found in lost worlds and unsettled regions, those who dwell in the oceans of the world do not contain their hunting grounds to specific regions. As a result, it's not unheard of for a wandering specimen to find its way to coastal waters. Those that do often find the ports of small towns or even large cities to be wondrous banquets and are usually hunted down by coastal guards or adventurers. When a wayward elasmosaurus like this finds its way into a city's sewer system or reservoirs, though, it can become the stuff of urban legends.

bC1xvgHpQUnix9Bt.name: Deep Breath
bC1xvgHpQUnix9Bt.description: The elasmosaurus can hold its breath for 2 hours.

FpcxdJ4oqnyX8sBs.name: Long Neck
FpcxdJ4oqnyX8sBs.description: An elasmosaurus's long neck allows it to interact with the surface while its body remains submerged underwater. While submerged no deeper than 15 feet underwater, an elasmosaurus can still stick its head up to breathe. An elasmosaurus gains cover against attacks made against creatures who are above the water's surface while it is underwater, even if its head is above the surface.

Q0zvzLaylr0AYBGR.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

qgyml1ToPqFdJIKa.name: Drag Below
qgyml1ToPqFdJIKa.description: The elasmosaurus attempts an Athletics check against a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} foe's Fortitude DC. If the elasmosaurus succeeds, the foe is forcibly moved 5 feet toward the elasmosaurus's body. If the elasmosaurus critically succeeds, the foe is moved 10 feet towards the elasmosaurus's body.

PF6tfwJNh5sVOavs.name: Thrashing Retreat
PF6tfwJNh5sVOavs.description: A swimming elasmosaurus thrashes the area around it as it attempts to flee. It makes two paddle Strikes, each of which must be against separate targets, and each of which takes the normal multiple attack penalty. It then Swims up to its swim Speed. This Swim does not trigger reactions based on movement.

Ember Fox.name: Ember Fox
Ember Fox.publicNotes: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.name: Cloak in Embers
JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.

Emperor Cobra.name: Emperor Cobra
Emperor Cobra.publicNotes: These aggressive serpents infest bogs and lowlands. Despite a length of over 16 feet and weighing over 200 pounds, they can climb trees in seconds. An emperor cobra wards off predators by flaring its hood and hissing at its attacker.

1MWjpvCpwBy0BFwq.name: Emperor Cobra Venom
1MWjpvCpwBy0BFwq.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] ,

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d8}[poison]]]{1d8 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d8}[poison]]]{1d8 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round)

LvD2kKe3HyLRK3Gr.name: Flare Hood
LvD2kKe3HyLRK3Gr.description:
The emperor cobra flares its hood. Each non-emperor cobra creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Eremite.name: Eremite
Eremite.publicNotes:
Eremites roam the planes to seek out ideal portions of other creatures, such as a hero's sword-arm or an angel's pinions. Eremites capture these specimens to clinically test their true limits, then harvest specimens and add them to their own bodies. An eremite might attach tongues to their hand as extra fingers or a fist to the back of their neck in a horrid "improvement." Eremites average 7 feet tall and weigh approximately 200 pounds.

The search for ultimate sensation through self-mutilation is the horrifying preoccupation of the shadow-dwelling fiends known as velstracs. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of torture, or when turning their agonizing practices back on themselves. Velstracs consider themselves enlightened beings, transcending such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, but their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict sadistic suffering. These fiends claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don't recognize any refinement that doesn't require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.

Velstracs manifest from the souls of the most extreme masochistic or sadistic mortals who are judged and sent on to the Shadow Plane. They take on forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the maestros of suffering and mutilation called eremites. The process of transformation warps the soul step by step, with other velstracs conveying their new members through untold chambers of pain among the dark reaches of the Shadow Plane.
Eremite.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

LdMlE7uRJEkPdKUA.name: 行影术(随意施法) Shadow Walk (At will)
LdMlE7uRJEkPdKUA.description: 你进入幽影位面，使用其空间扭曲的性质来加速旅行。目标通过幽影位面和物质位面的交界处进入幽影位面的边界。目标在幽影位面中无法看见物质位面（但该位面的一些事物可能是物质位面的模糊投影）。在幽影位面中时，目标可能会遭遇到该位面的原住民。在位面交界之间的幽影会折叠空间，能相对物质位面加速你的旅行。每沿着该交界旅行3分钟，目标会如同在物质位面上旅行1小时。在任何时刻，目标可以解消该法术的效果，但这只影响该目标。幽影的折叠是不准确的，所以当法术结束时，目标会出现在物质位面中距离目标地点大致1英里远的地方（但一同旅行并且在幽影位面同一点解消该法术的目标会在同一位置出现）。

c8DVpWzqdTXj4S64.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
c8DVpWzqdTXj4S64.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

KceVAfrBOyOgCGUj.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At will)
KceVAfrBOyOgCGUj.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

RTunxYN9r4ztOeQC.name: 异界传送(仅限主物质位面或阴影位面) Plane Shift (To Material Plane or Shadow Plane only)
RTunxYN9r4ztOeQC.description: 你和你的盟友穿过位面之间的屏障。目标移动到另一个位面，例如火焰位面（Plane of Fire），阴影位面（Shadow Plane），或者深渊（Abyss）。你必须对目的地位面有所了解，并且使用该位面的材料制作的魔法共鸣音叉作为该法术的器材。多数主要位面的共鸣音叉，如同异界传送法术本身一样，罕贵度为罕见。鲜为人知的位面和半位面的共鸣音叉通常罕贵度为稀有。该法术非常不精确，你会在某个目标（由你选择）上次到达该位面时所在的位置相距1d20×25英里的位置出现。如果对所有目标而言均是第一次旅行到特定位面，你会在位面上的一个随机位置出现。异界传送 不会提供返程的方法，但是通过再次施放异界传送令你能回到你之前所在的位面，除非有什么另外情况。

ZYBGyu05L6Ve0V1r.name: 幽影虹吸(随意施法) Shadow Siphon (At will)
ZYBGyu05L6Ve0V1r.description:
触发 一个法术或者魔法效果造成伤害。

你通过将物质位面的能量和幽影位面的能量交换，令目标法术变成了一种部分为幻术的形式。尝试反制目标法术。如果该尝试成功，任何会被该法术伤害的生物仅承受一半的伤害。但该法术在其他方面如常运作。在这次尝试中，幽影虹吸的反制等级视为高2级。

bQ7xqBShE3D6pEMf.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

gAdwnZ4OP8sPpuOg.name: Painsight
gAdwnZ4OP8sPpuOg.description: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.

fBpvD0xb43MGDESG.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

NsRn4K2Tli8P3WKm.name: Ignore Pain
NsRn4K2Tli8P3WKm.description: An eremite's actions can't be disrupted due to damage or Strikes (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.NMWXHGWUcZGoLDKb]{Attack of Opportunity}).

UEAEQewstiRA9wbc.name: Paralytic Perfection
UEAEQewstiRA9wbc.description:
30 feet.

When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it feels compelled to offer pieces of its own flesh to the eremite. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

BfXMGYIBKEZIaKVV.name: Evisceration
BfXMGYIBKEZIaKVV.description:
Requirements The eremite has a creature grabbed

Effect The eremite excises flesh or bone from a creature it has grabbed. The target takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed6d10.success].

pmHXQt1EgMIVwD1i.name: Exquisite Pain
pmHXQt1EgMIVwD1i.description:
An eremite's knowledge of pressure points and pain centers is unsurpassed. A creature hit by an eremite's melee Strikes must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} on a critical failure).

A creature that critically succeeds is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

4b9FtRKJfWmjYbQR.name: Focus Gaze
4b9FtRKJfWmjYbQR.description:
The eremite stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against paralytic perfection.

In addition, if the creature was already paralyzed, on a failed save, its unnatural longing causes it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the eremite's next turn.

03MMQCPuK2UJR1Z6.name: Graft Flesh
03MMQCPuK2UJR1Z6.description:
Requirements The eremite holds a piece of flesh they collected via Evisceration

Effect The eremite attaches the stolen flesh to themself. They either regain 100 Hit Points; reduce the value of their clumsy, drained, enfeebled, or stupefied condition by 3; or reduce the stage of any affliction affecting them by 3.

isUs3BDvVUggXstu.name: Shadow Traveler
isUs3BDvVUggXstu.description: When an eremite uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Plane Shift} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.rxvS7EMJ7qmexAyA]{Shadow Walk}, they arrive at exactly their intended destination.

Esobok.name: Esobok
Esobok.publicNotes: Esoboks are brute hunters and pugnacious sentinels that serve as the guard dogs of the Boneyard. These squat, powerful quadrupeds have a frill of dark feathers around their distinctive heads which resemble a crocodile skull. Esoboks rarely bother with those who are truly dead, allowing the dead of the Boneyard to go about their business while remaining watchful for danger. Though cunning when sniffing out threats to the Boneyard or to their psychopomp handlers, they're among the least intelligent of the psychopomps and rarely speak except to utter growling threats. The wise listen when an esobok makes a threat, as it won't do so twice.

QRGAhXT66Xuc32WM.name: 隐形术(仅限自身) Invisibility (Self only)
QRGAhXT66Xuc32WM.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

B0vz4xw1pLJ9FeyD.name: Pounce
B0vz4xw1pLJ9FeyD.description: The esobok Strides and then makes a Strike. If it began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the Strike.

elLeiMASiyy7jPxz.name: Spirit Touch
elLeiMASiyy7jPxz.description: An esobok's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} to living creatures and [[/r {1d6}[positive]]]{1d6 positive damage} to undead.

qXrvqRXGNuAyfORa.name: Wrench Spirit
qXrvqRXGNuAyfORa.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the esobok's jaws

Effect The esobok releases the target from the Grab but wrenches its spirit free as it does so. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:20] save. Creatures without souls (such as most constructs) and creatures whose bodies and souls are one (such as most celestials, fiends, and monitors) that roll a failure or critical failure on the save get a success instead.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The esobok wrenches the target's soul from its body into its jaws. mindless undead creatures of level 2 or lower are destroyed, other undead creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} for 1 round, and all other creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, a creature paralyzed by this effect can attempt a new save to end the effect. The paralysis ends automatically if the esobok attempts a jaws Strike or speaks.

Critical Failure As failure, but as long as a creature is stunned or paralyzed, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Fen Mosquito Swarm.name: Fen Mosquito Swarm
Fen Mosquito Swarm.publicNotes: When deadly fen mosquitoes gather in large numbers, they form into lethal swarms capable of draining blood at a truly alarming rate. Fen mosquito swarms are typically encountered only in tropical swamps or bogs, but during humid months in spring or summer they can drift into riverine areas or even through the waterfront reaches of settlements.

jwprc3z4QABxyA1y.name: Pyrexic Malaria
jwprc3z4QABxyA1y.description:
The victim can't reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition while it's affected by pyrexic malaria

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Onset 4 days

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

9O71o5KF846nZWVa.name: Swarming Bites
9O71o5KF846nZWVa.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {1d6}[piercing]]]{1d6 piercing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save) and is exposed to pyrexic malaria. Creatures that fail the saving throw also take @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success].

Fetchling Scout.name: Fetchling Scout
Fetchling Scout.publicNotes:
The people known today as fetchlings are a distinct ancestry descended from generations of humans who became trapped ages ago on the Shadow Plane. No longer human at all, these people, who call themselves kayals, have become monochromatic in coloration, with flesh tones and hair colors varying between white, black, and all shades of gray. Their limbs are lithe and willowy, and their eyes are generally solid yellow, yellow-green, or white, though a rare few have a purple or blue glow.

Fetchlings have developed their own complex societies in the Shadow Plane, often under the tolerance of or in servitude to the strange, malignant creatures there, such as the sinister velstracs or the enigmatic d'ziriaks. While individual fetchlings can be any alignment, they are all survivors in a harsh environment, which leads to a tendency toward pragmatism. Fetchling clothing mimics the regions they dwell in, with drab colors tending toward darker shades. When they trade with humans or other societies on the Material Plane, they often wear masks or concealing clothing to hide their appearance.

Typical fetchling communities are insular and swiftly close ranks in the event of an intruder. Though individual fetchlings don't mind traveling to and blending in with other societies to facilitate trade, they often hide or even react defensively if they have their own visitors. When one considers the nature of the other denizens of the Shadow Plane, however, this tendency to assume the worst of interlopers might make sense to some.

Fetchlings are not as common on the Material Plane; most of those who dwell there are loners by choice who have left their home to seek out adventure elsewhere, exiles who were banished from their homelands, or planar castaways with no ability to return to the Shadow Plane. This last category, the lost and stranded, are the most likely to be found in larger groups. In cities of significant size, one can sometimes even find a small community of a few dozen or more fetchlings living among humans, although they often do so subtly by dyeing their hair, wearing brightly colored clothing, and utilizing layers of makeup to hide their pallid complexions.

P6oJVM0MDCy82QgU.name: Shadow Blending
P6oJVM0MDCy82QgU.description: When the fetchling scout is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} as a result of dim light, the flat check to target them has a DC of 7, not 5.

PpVuZdKsS2ms3K3h.name: Shadow Stride
PpVuZdKsS2ms3K3h.description:
Requirements The fetchling is in dim light

Effect The fetchling Strides. They have a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this Stride, and the fetchling remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by dim light until the end of the movement, even if they leave dim light during the Stride.

mcOn5wJPK3EDRCeU.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
mcOn5wJPK3EDRCeU.description:
The fetchling scout's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} creatures.

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Filth Fire.name: Filth Fire
Filth Fire.publicNotes: These creatures look like roiling clouds of black smoke churning above a mound of burning refuse. Leering faces form and fade in the smoke above, while the burning trash writhes in spasmodic lurches, obviously alive.

F7GzmZlJ6PXy8Cm5.name: Smoke Vision
F7GzmZlJ6PXy8Cm5.description: The filth fire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

nxblqBzJUsncnJ9t.name: Noxious Burst
nxblqBzJUsncnJ9t.description:
Toxic materials and churning rubbish within the filth fire's body explode in one of three ways. The filth fire chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice twice in a row.

  • Fiery Beam (evocation, fire, primal) The filth fire expels a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of flame that deals [[/r {3d6}[fire]]]{3d6 fire damage} with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|traits:evocation,fire,primal|overrideTraits:true] save.
  • Shrapnel Blast (evocation, primal) The filth fire shoots jagged rubbish out in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] that deals [[/r {2d12}[piercing]]]{2d12 piercing damage} with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|traits:evocation,primal|overrideTraits:true] save.
  • Toxic Fumes (evocation, poison, primal) The filth fire belches a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of toxic smoke that deals [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|basic:true|traits:evocation,poison,primal|overrideTraits:true] save). A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Fire Jellyfish Swarm.name: Fire Jellyfish Swarm
Fire Jellyfish Swarm.publicNotes: While individually one of these fist-sized jellyfish is merely a nuisance, in great numbers, fire jellyfish can form into dangerous swarms. Bobbing in the water, they create a cloud of stinging tentacles. They were named in part for their bright coloration, but those who are stung by fire jellyfish learn the larger reason for their name-the pain of their stings is comparable to being burned alive.

lugrDlIHRd8kGDKs.name: Burning Swarm
lugrDlIHRd8kGDKs.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {3d8}[poison]]]{3d8 poison damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true] save) and is exposed to fire jelly venom.

nhcCpe4q2AuE5rBl.name: Fire Jelly Venom
nhcCpe4q2AuE5rBl.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Fire Yai.name: Fire Yai
Fire Yai.publicNotes: Fire yai take the form of fire giants. Like fire giants, fire yai are shrewd and militaristic and have an incredible appetite for the thrill of war. While they engage in battle to conquer and control others, fire yai also love the thrill of war, fighting for the sheer joy of it. Presenting a fire yai with a true challenge in combat can potentially earn their mercy and an offer to join and serve at their side. Fire yai's third eyes shoot forth burning missiles of fire.
Fire Yai.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

YVBJxmLTHes9asum.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At will) (Self only)
YVBJxmLTHes9asum.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

iznQySJVx9S3aKAQ.name: +2 Striking Katana
iznQySJVx9S3aKAQ.description: A katana is a curved, single‑edged sword known for its wickedly sharped blade.

k4Emo2tqftGwEdIo.name: +1 Resilient Breastplate
k4Emo2tqftGwEdIo.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

HFAfo9jbjahhbw5J.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

4f8Xn8AVpubItk3h.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

7x3Iu1Xd8r44ZR48.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

J0ri0JZTtI3g3kxN.name: Change Shape
J0ri0JZTtI3g3kxN.description:
The fire yai takes on the appearance of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.80TiZrVvIBW7E6L2]{Fire Giant}. This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

0t8zkWyTQVqJBcMG.name: Impaling Push
0t8zkWyTQVqJBcMG.description:
The fire yai attempts a katana Strike. If it hits, the fire yai attempts an Athletics check against the target creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success The fire yai Strides or Flies up to half its Speed in any direction. The struck creature takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed4d6.success] and is pushed along with the yai an equal distance. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the yai's next turn or until the yai makes a katana Strike.

Success As critical success, but the creature takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d6.success].

Failure The struck creature is pushed back 5 feet.

Critical Failure The struck creature is unaffected.

lJ7R0wPVIxspGA72.name: Smoke Form
lJ7R0wPVIxspGA72.description:
The fire yai transforms into a cloud of smoke and then Flies up to its fly speed. This movement does not trigger reactions, and the fire yai can move through spaces occupied by other creatures. The fire yai returns to its physical form after this move, and must end the movement in a space in which it can fit.

All creatures in spaces through which the fire yai moves with Smoke Form must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

The fire yai cannot use Smoke Form for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Fjord Linnorm.name: Fjord Linnorm
Fjord Linnorm.publicNotes: Fjord linnorms make their homes in damp caves behind ice-cold waterfalls in the river-veined coastal reaches of the north. While they may appear graceful as they swim up the fjords for which they're named, they are as vile as any other of their species and take pleasures in capsizing river boats before gobbling up their terrified crews.
Fjord Linnorm.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

pX8XlXGbLapNVOQT.name: 行动自如(恒定法术) Freedom of Movement (Constant)
pX8XlXGbLapNVOQT.description: 你驱散可能会阻碍一个生物或者令其移动减慢的效果。当处于该法术效果中时，法术目标忽视会赋予其速度环境减值的效果。当法术目标尝试 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} 一个令其 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}或 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的效果时，它自动成功，除非该效果是魔法性的，并且其环级比行动自如更高。

XSu8EpdK6CVQXvZe.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
XSu8EpdK6CVQXvZe.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

JWaVcBKV9F51VWja.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

zIgTjSPfr6rcIZod.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

0gNZbOZYyi010Pow.name: Curse of Stolen Breath
0gNZbOZYyi010Pow.description: When a creature slays a fjord linnorm, it must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41] save or become unable to ever breathe underwater (either via a natural ability or a spell such as water breathing). In addition, the victim can hold its breath only half as long as normal, and whenever it holds its breath it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

mBjJ5gUJvowlXzIH.name: Breath Weapon
mBjJ5gUJvowlXzIH.description:
The fjord linnorm expels a @Template[type:line|distance:120] of icy bile, dealing [[/r {17d6}[cold]]]{17d6 cold damage} to creatures within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save). Any creature that fails its save is covered by the ice, which freezes and fuses with the creature's skin, giving it a -10-foot penalty to Speed. A creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the ice (DC 34) to free itself; otherwise, the ice remains for 1 minute.

The fjord linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

wyy8wN5QiLr4fV2L.name: Fjord Linnorm Venom
wyy8wN5QiLr4fV2L.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {4d6}[cold]]]{4d6 cold damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {6d6}[cold]]]{6d6 cold damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Flytrap Leshy.name: Flytrap Leshy
Flytrap Leshy.publicNotes:
While often seen as unfriendly by non-leshys, flytrap leshys get along well with other leshys. Nonetheless, they're among the most aggressive leshys, often guarding the most vulnerable places in the natural world with their flytrap mouths and hands.

When a large threat emerges, pairs of flytrap leshys band together to create amalgams capable of driving back powerful foes. This unusual form of communal defense suffuses flytrap leshy society, and they often form relationships between multiple individuals that would confuse or even scandalize more uptight humanoids-to a flytrap leshy, though, there's nothing strange about sharing your innermost secrets with people you literally merged together with to defend your home from an enemy.

mXh2p5FT7dkLC4KJ.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

yooFGlf4aPfCD1vV.name: Verdant Burst
yooFGlf4aPfCD1vV.description:
When a flytrap leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring [[/r {3d6}[healing]]]{3d6 Hit Points} to each plant creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30].

This area immediately fills with flytraps, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these flytraps, they wither after 24 hours.

qxsT5YmSCH2dqJAT.name: Amalgam
qxsT5YmSCH2dqJAT.description:
A flytrap leshy can combine itself with an adjacent and willing flytrap leshy that is not currently affected by Amalgam. The leshy using Amalgam physically merges with the target, restoring [[/r {3d8}[healing]]]{3d8 Hit Points} to the target.

The leshy can Sustain a Spell to continue Amalgam, but once they stop, the target leshy takes [[/r {3d8}]]{3d8 damage}. If the target leshy dies, Amalgam ends at once and the original leshy gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition or increases their dying condition value by 1 if they were already dying.

As long as Amalgam is sustained, the target leshy gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws, its AC increases to 21, and it gains an additional reaction at the start of each turn.

BJelgf4pdEHXMd9u.name: Change Shape
BJelgf4pdEHXMd9u.description:
The flytrap leshy transforms into a Small flytrap. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{Tree Shape}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Froghemoth.name: Froghemoth
Froghemoth.publicNotes: A terrifying abomination of teeth, tentacles, and unbridled rage, the froghemoth is thankfully rarely encountered even in the deepest swamplands or most remote Darklands caverns. Capable of devouring dinosaurs and even dragons, it is a frighteningly effective ambush hunter, immersing itself in the mire with only its eyestalk protruding and watching in every direction at once with uncanny precision.

zdW63lmShrSpZWkm.name: Otherworldly Vision
zdW63lmShrSpZWkm.description: A froghemoth's alien eyes allow it to perceive creatures within 30 feet, even if they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} or ethereal. It can still be fooled by successful Stealth checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, but it has @Check[type:perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] in such cases. It also sees through and is unaffected by illusions with the visual trait if they are within 30 feet.

pfYqWHlnkQUBpJIo.name: Electric Torpor
pfYqWHlnkQUBpJIo.description: Though a froghemoth is immune to electricity damage, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round whenever it would have otherwise taken electricity damage.

2KNgUCdMbbr8kaE7.name: Barbed Tongue
2KNgUCdMbbr8kaE7.description:
A creature hit by the froghemoth's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the froghemoth. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the froghemoth's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful Strike against AC 31 that deals at least 15 slashing damage.

This deals no damage to the froghemoth but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 minute.

tVBujCEfyKPKjA2Q.name: Flailing Tentacles
tVBujCEfyKPKjA2Q.description: The froghemoth makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These count toward the froghemoth's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

BfQDGpd8cSNGgENd.name: Retract Tongue
BfQDGpd8cSNGgENd.description: The froghemoth pulls a creature grabbed by its tongue toward itself. The froghemoth rolls an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the froghemoth pulls the creature into an adjacent space, and if it critically succeeds it can also make a bite Strike against the creature after the pull.

Frost Troll.name: Frost Troll
Frost Troll.publicNotes: Frost trolls are nightmarish frozen monsters of rime-stained claws and hoarfrost teeth. Possessing wits superior to those of common trolls, frost trolls often hunt in packs of three-one attacking their quarry openly while the remaining two pause to assess weaknesses before moving in for the kill. Frost trolls relish the taste of human flesh and adjust their hunting grounds seasonally to remain in close proximity to their favorite prey. Of slighter frame than common trolls, a typical frost troll stands 11 feet tall when not hunched and weighs 900 pounds. Their sickly, cracked flesh is of an icy, cerulean pallor. Frost trolls often adorn themselves with trophies of bone and hide flayed from their kills.

ZoL2vMSlQqYIUJAX.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

8JhtIGFYB5PcTSIt.name: Ice Stride
8JhtIGFYB5PcTSIt.description: A frost troll isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

Frost Worm.name: Frost Worm
Frost Worm.publicNotes:
The frost worm's single round, red eye gleams prominently at the head of its monstrous mass, white as a winter snowfall. What appears to be a bifurcated lower jaw is actually two spiky parapodia that the worm uses to shovel food into its lamprey-like mouth. An adult frost worm measures 35 feet long and weighs 8,000 pounds.

A frost worm is an apex predator that uses camouflage, burrowing, and deceit to ambush its prey. When it attacks, a frost worm produces a distinctive, high-pitched trill. Though some survivors of frost worm attacks have compared it to a wailing lament, the trill has a captivating effect on nearby creatures, causing them to stop and listen even as the monstrous creature approaches.

The cold shed by a frost worm is as dangerous as its trill or its jaws, and while it is not fond of warmer climates, neither is it particularly hampered in such regions. A frost worm that somehow finds itself in temperate or even tropical environs causes the immediate area to chill and ice over with frost over time, creating seemingly impossible pockets of frozen terrain.

MPJFQqOrPfQloQLr.name: Death Throes
MPJFQqOrPfQloQLr.description: When a frost worm dies, it explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:100] of searing cold blood. All creatures and objects in range take [[/r {10d8}[cold]]]{10d8 cold damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

jISdvlh9f3wIBxZ8.name: Freezing Blood
jISdvlh9f3wIBxZ8.description:
Trigger The frost worm takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect The frost worm's freezing blood sprays out on a random creature within 10 feet of the frost worm. That creature takes [[/r {7d6}[cold]]]{7d6 cold damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

GFW3IASGrcBSyETb.name: Worm Chill
GFW3IASGrcBSyETb.description:
5 feet.

A creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation takes [[/r {3d6}[cold]]]{3d6 cold damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

BdPJLN1AK4im8nIu.name: Breath Weapon
BdPJLN1AK4im8nIu.description:
The frost worm exhales a blast of frost, dealing [[/r {13d6}[cold]]]{13d6 cold damage} to creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

KtIqgI2Oe8cbrguF.name: Worm Trill
KtIqgI2Oe8cbrguF.description:
The frost worm emits a hypnotic trill. Each non-frost worm creature within 100 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save. The effects of Worm Trill last for 1 round, but if the frost worm uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends this duration by 1 round for any creature already affected.

Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to Worm Trill for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the frost worm.

Critical Failure As failure, but the fascinated condition doesn't end if the frost worm uses hostile actions against the creature.

Ghonhatine.name: Ghonhatine
Ghonhatine.publicNotes:
In transforming xulgaths, drow fleshwarpers sought not to create a new type of creature but to recapture a form of xulgath predecessor believed entirely vanished from Golarion. Ghonhatines are the result-hulking reptilian beasts who prefer to crawl on all fours and tear at their foes with bestial fury.

Horrid abominations reshaped by vile alchemical magic, the two fleshwarps presented here were created by drow, who transform captured elves or xulgaths into twisted monstrosities that can then be loosed to cause havoc and terror.

GEb3KusxBDvL8CkC.name: Stench
GEb3KusxBDvL8CkC.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

pmfr4MB1abUN5RbW.name: Feed
pmfr4MB1abUN5RbW.description:
Requirements The ghonhatine is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghonhatine devours a chunk of the corpse. For 1 minute, the ghonhatine gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing 5} and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. It can gain these benefits from any given corpse only once.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wPW6kVscJgBLPVKZ]{Effect: Ghonhatine Feed}

HIRmU6WblxuDmWc6.name: Fleshgout
HIRmU6WblxuDmWc6.description:
A ghonhatine's vomit carries an awful disease that, over time, can cause a suffering creature's flesh to develop painful boils that eventually slough away, leaving gaping wounds

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/r 1d4 #Incubation]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 enfeebled 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}, enfeebled 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 6 dead

Giant Amoeba.name: Giant Amoeba
Giant Amoeba.publicNotes: These blobs of nearly transparent protoplasm are identical in form and behavior to the microscopic creatures from which they have evolved, except their outlandish size makes them all the more dangerous. Unlike slimes, puddings, and other deadly oozes, giant amoebas have an outer membrane that contains their internal structures, making them more susceptible to slashing weapons than their amorphous kin. However, this membrane is also extremely flexible and permeable, allowing them to surround prey and absorb it, suffocating and slowly digesting it in the amoeba's acidic fluids.

N9in8b8yuAVDLoyD.name: Motion Sense
N9in8b8yuAVDLoyD.description: A giant amoeba can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

aQDe7We9BV7qqiIm.name: Envelop
aQDe7We9BV7qqiIm.description:
Requirements The giant amoeba begins its turn with a target its size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The giant amoeba maintains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} and extends pseudopods to surround the creature and pull it inside the amoeba's body. This thereafter has the same effect as if the amoeba had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (DC 17, [[/r {1d6}[acid]]]{1d6 acid damage}, Escape DC 17, Rupture 3).

eQGUATVlHv8iZ97x.name: Weak Acid
eQGUATVlHv8iZ97x.description: A giant amoeba's acid damages only organic material-not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

Giant Ant.name: Giant Ant
Giant Ant.publicNotes:
Giant ants are much like their smaller kin in their industrious habits, though growing to the size of ponies makes them much deadlier.

Ants are industrious insects that aid the natural processes of decay and renewal.

izA7GPk45mKcDG02.name: Giant Ant Venom
izA7GPk45mKcDG02.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d8}[poison]]]{1d8 poison} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {1d12}[poison]]]{1d12 poison} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)

EhmJLz0h6EUzbywV.name: Haul Away
EhmJLz0h6EUzbywV.description:
Requirements The giant ant has a Large or smaller creature grabbed

Effect The giant ant Strides up to its full Speed, carrying the grabbed creature with it. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered} if the grabbed creature is Medium or larger.

Giant Badger.name: Giant Badger
Giant Badger.publicNotes:
The violent, territorial giant badger is a relentless predator. An obligate carnivore, its prey ranges from rabbits to deer, livestock, and even the occasional traveler or adventurer. A giant badger's claws are sharp and strong enough to carve tunnels from solid rock. They typically stand 4 feet tall at the shoulder and weigh 500 pounds.

The burrowing badger is plentiful in most temperate forests. All badgers are naturally fierce and tenacious, and their squat stature belies their strength and speed.

iSVPM2m77YXV78mJ.name: Badger Rage
iSVPM2m77YXV78mJ.description:
The giant badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first.

While raging, the giant badger has AC 17, its jaws Strike deals 1d8+8 damage, and its claw Strike deals 1d6+6 damage. While raging, the giant badger also can't use actions that have the concentrate trait except for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}.

After it has stopped raging, a giant badger can't use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Giant Chameleon.name: Giant Chameleon
Giant Chameleon.publicNotes: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.name: Camouflage
qbn93YsujSFI6TMZ.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} with a Stealth check.

sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.name: Tongue Grab
sguXTwhSIa1swJ1p.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Giant Cockroach.name: Giant Cockroach
Giant Cockroach.publicNotes: Cockroaches are communal creatures, rarely setting out on their own unless they are searching for food. If an adventurer encounters a single giant cockroach while exploring, they had best take precautions against others, as there is likely an entire colony nearby.

aJhXMbTAQPFT4ySw.name: Scurry
aJhXMbTAQPFT4ySw.description:
Trigger The giant cockroach is targeted by a melee attack

Effect The giant cockroach gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the cockroach Strides, Climbs, or Flies up to 10 feet.

Giant Crab.name: Giant Crab
Giant Crab.publicNotes:
Crabs are scavenging crustaceans known for their hard shells and iconic sideways gait. They use their claws to defend themselves, hunt, and fight other crabs for territory. When confronted with threats from outside their species, most crabs prefer to flee, but when retreat isn't possible, they clamp on to their foes as tightly as they can.

The statistics presented here represent giant crabs that live close to the water's surface. Crabs that live deeper underwater often exhibit more extreme adaptations to their environment. Crabs who live in the depths where little light reaches gain darkvision and cold resistance, and those adapted to the most hostile reaches of the deep sea can detect nearby creatures through subtle shifts in ocean currents.

These skittering creatures are prized for their delicious meat, but their size makes them dangerous targets for harvesting.

ez4TlFP9ir8diYv7.name: Scuttle
ez4TlFP9ir8diYv7.description:
Trigger A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack

Effect The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can Stride up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.

WXEuGWzgAk5JMfEE.name: Vulnerable to Prone
WXEuGWzgAk5JMfEE.description: If a creature critically succeeds on a check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab that is flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal -2 circumstance penalty to AC for being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}, it takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.

Giant Crawling Hand.name: Giant Crawling Hand
Giant Crawling Hand.publicNotes:
A giant crawling hand is the appendage of a very large creature, such as a giant.

Typically, crawling hands are formed when severed appendages are endowed with a crude sentience by evil necromantic energies that turn them into tireless killers. Yet crawling hands can also arise spontaneously, usually when a creature loses an appendage in a place rife with necromantic energy or with a connection to the Negative Energy Plane.

l6ptuF1kw5FfVHfl.name: Pus Burst
l6ptuF1kw5FfVHfl.description:
Trigger The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals [[/r {4d6}[negative]]]{4d6 negative damage}. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

QACVidUBGQoHHpqW.name: Mark Quarry
QACVidUBGQoHHpqW.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.

Giant Dragonfly.name: Giant Dragonfly
Giant Dragonfly.publicNotes: These buzzing insects are the size of a small horse. They are ambush predators known to hunt beasts and humanoids alike, capable of using impressive aerial acrobatics to swoop down from above and snatch away their prey.

vVt7KeVPbqT0jHZQ.name: Clutch
vVt7KeVPbqT0jHZQ.description:
Requirements The giant dragonfly has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its mandibles

Effect The dragonfly tries to transfer the grabbed creature to be clutched by its legs. The giant dragonfly attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, it transfers the creature (which remains grabbed) to its legs, freeing its mandibles to attack. The dragonfly can have only one creature clutched at a time.

DPcRdZIL38qcDj2I.name: Snatch
DPcRdZIL38qcDj2I.description: The giant dragonfly can Fly at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by Clutch, carrying that creature along with it.

xXv6eUeKYXjO80rc.name: Swoop
xXv6eUeKYXjO80rc.description: The giant dragonfly Flies up to its Speed and makes one mandible Strike at any point during that movement.

Giant Dragonfly Nymph.name: Giant Dragonfly Nymph
Giant Dragonfly Nymph.publicNotes: The aquatic, wingless offspring of dragonflies are called dragonfly nymphs. Giant dragonfly nymphs can be several feet in length and mostly hunt in shallow waters, eating carrion and ambushing living creatures with their fully grown counterparts. They are not daunted by larger creatures, compelled by their instinct to eat as much as possible to sustain their growth.

clxrPF7TPJ4sS2A6.name: Extend Mandibles
clxrPF7TPJ4sS2A6.description: The giant dragonfly nymph extends its jaws to a surprising distance. The dragonfly nymph makes a mandibles Strike with a reach of 10 feet, but the mandibles lose the agile trait for this Strike.

Giant Fly.name: Giant Fly
Giant Fly.publicNotes:
This pony-sized fly's twitching limbs seem to never stop moving as it constantly cleans itself and scoops anything edible into its mouthparts. While primarily carrion eaters, giant flies sometimes prey on livestock or other animals too slow to get away.

Giant flies are pony-sized insects that have massive compound eyes and bodies bristling with short, stiff hairs. Their lairs are notorious for the rotting meat they stockpile to lay their eggs into. Their maggot-dens are also prime breeding grounds for virulent diseases.

GimuDrJ7GoLAne8i.name: Avoid the Swat
GimuDrJ7GoLAne8i.description:
Trigger The giant fly is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see

Effect The giant fly gains a +2 circumstance bonus against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the giant insect can Fly up to its fly Speed.

kGJwFA2RdVWHs6ty.name: Fly Pox
kGJwFA2RdVWHs6ty.description:
A giant fly could carry any disease, but most transmit a virulent but not fatal infection called Fly Pox with their bite

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 as stage 3 (1 day)

Stage 5 enfeebled 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Giant Frog.name: Giant Frog
Giant Frog.publicNotes: Giant frogs can grow up to 6 feet long and weigh over 200 pounds, with rows of razor-sharp teeth lining their gaping mouths.

YhTp7RIQLVLYYNUn.name: Sticky Feet
YhTp7RIQLVLYYNUn.description: Giant frogs are not flat-footed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balancing} on a narrow surface, and they gain a +4 bonus to Reflex saves to avoid falling.

YlO5up5kkSrroKf6.name: Tongue Grab
YlO5up5kkSrroKf6.description:
A creature hit by the giant frog's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant frog. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the frog's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a Strike against AC 13 that deals at least 2 slashing damage.

This deals no damage to the frog but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Giant Hippocampus.name: Giant Hippocampus
Giant Hippocampus.publicNotes: Living in the deepest reaches of the ocean, giant hippocampi haven't been sighted near the shore and are often regarded as legends made up by sailors.

FNSLMfCQHDGPvjsv.name: Sudden Retreat
FNSLMfCQHDGPvjsv.description: The giant hippocampus makes a tail Strike, then Swims with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its swim Speed. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement.

Giant Jellyfish.name: Giant Jellyfish
Giant Jellyfish.publicNotes: Unlike its smaller cousins, the giant jellyfish is an active predator that chases down its prey through reefs or open water. It can even squeeze its enormous bell-shaped body into the tight confines of shipwrecks to drape its mane of tentacles across the exposed flesh of its prey.

8Xjni4fPUr5P0Dl9.name: Jellyfish Venom
8Xjni4fPUr5P0Dl9.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {2d8}[poison]]]{2d8 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {3d6}[poison]]]{3d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

F2cUCIHpa06Qkqy2.name: Squeeze
F2cUCIHpa06Qkqy2.description: A giant jellyfish can fit into tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. It can move at its full Speed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}.

Giant Leech.name: Giant Leech
Giant Leech.publicNotes: Capable of growing to lengths of nearly 5 feet, giant leeches have circular maws filled with hook-like teeth. They prefer to dwell in stagnant or slow-moving shallow water or in damp, moist undergrowth. Horses and larger animals are their favorite prey, but they won't balk at a chance to latch onto a human- or halfling-sized meal.

OQMwQiE7vGLPMasL.name: Blood Drain
OQMwQiE7vGLPMasL.description:
Requirements The giant leech has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The giant leech drains blood from the creature it has grabbed. This deals [[/r 2d4]] damage. A creature that has its blood drained by a giant leech is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives any kind or amount of healing.

Giant Maggot.name: Giant Maggot
Giant Maggot.publicNotes:
Giant flies lay their eggs on the bodies of larger monsters or livestock. When they hatch, these eggs release squirming maggots the size of human children, ravenous young who voraciously consume any flesh in the immediate vicinity-typically starting with the body upon which they were born.

Giant flies are pony-sized insects that have massive compound eyes and bodies bristling with short, stiff hairs. Their lairs are notorious for the rotting meat they stockpile to lay their eggs into. Their maggot-dens are also prime breeding grounds for virulent diseases.

3YdQIsd5sKYMGTIc.name: Regurgitation
3YdQIsd5sKYMGTIc.description:
Trigger The giant maggot takes damage

Effect The giant maggot regurgitates its rancid, foul meal. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

The giant maggot can't use Regurgitation again until it spends at least an hour feeding on a corpse.

zvArmvrursLxbgGq.name: Gnaw Flesh
zvArmvrursLxbgGq.description:
Requirements The giant maggot has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a creature

Effect The giant maggot deals [[/r {1d8+2}[slashing]]]{1d8+2 slashing damage} to the grabbed creature as it chews the creature's flesh (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save).

Giant Mosquito.name: Giant Mosquito
Giant Mosquito.publicNotes: These horrifically enlarged versions of the common mosquito often prey upon megafauna like dinosaurs and other large creatures, but they won't turn down a chance to drink the blood of a smaller target-such as a humanoid.

43gvQaRJhhjmfG3Z.name: Blood Drain
43gvQaRJhhjmfG3Z.description:
Requirements The giant mosquito has a creature grabbed

Effect The giant mosquito uses its proboscis to drain blood from the grabbed creature. This deals [[/r 3d6]] damage, and the giant mosquito gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a giant mosquito is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

eFiZ1wgGbxx9AVu1.name: Septic Malaria
eFiZ1wgGbxx9AVu1.description:
The victim can't reduce its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition while it's affected by septic malaria

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead

Giant Slug.name: Giant Slug
Giant Slug.publicNotes:
These massive, primeval relatives of ordinary slugs squirm slowly through swamps and grasslands. Giant slugs are always voracious and prefer to eat flesh or plants high in water content. They frequently consume livestock or strip bare entire orchards or melon crops. For cattle, pigs, or other sizable meals, they first shred the creatures using their radula-tongue-like appendages covered in teeth- to make them easier to consume. The mucus secreted by a giant slug is powerfully acidic and viscous. Wherever it travels, the creature leaves a trailing brown strip that kills most vegetation. Farmers and ranchers, especially those living near swamps known to contain giant slugs, keep close tabs on these journeys. Many almanacs go into great detail on slug migration and mating seasons. Since each giant slug needs its own wide hunting ground, the creatures typically come into proximity to mate only once a year. Either or both slugs can become impregnated, and any that do typically lay a clutch of around 100 eggs. They usually lay these eggs in a shallow bog or a cool, humid cave.

Giant slugs tend to travel at night, as the creatures dislike sunlight and dry weather. They have been known to seek out locations like barns, the undersides of bridges, or even fortifications like castles for shelter as dawn starts to break. Woe to the unprepared farmer who ambles out at sunrise to milk the cows but instead finds that a giant slug has made the barn its home! Subterranean giant slugs don't have to worry about sunlight, and crawl about on no schedule in particular. Narrow tunnels pose little obstacle for them, as the creatures can easily compress their bodies. These factors make their movements very unpredictable, so they pose quite a menace for underground peoples like kobolds or xulgaths.

HPPj6Nf4GtdwCAEx.name: No Hearing
HPPj6Nf4GtdwCAEx.description: A giant slug has no auditory senses. It is immune to auditory effects, automatically critically fails Perception checks that require it to hear, and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks (but not initiative rolls) that involve sound but also rely on other senses.

5WLytdwKYQa3JLh7.name: Malleable
5WLytdwKYQa3JLh7.description: The giant slug can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed. It can Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Medium creature, but it does so at the usual Speed for Squeezing.

72YvqHEAOHV34zLK.name: Mucus
72YvqHEAOHV34zLK.description: Any creature hit by the giant slug or that moves into its mucus trail is coated in sticky, caustic mucus. It takes [[/r {1d4}[persistent,acid]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Acid Damage} and takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the damage persists.

3s66FP7raqgSCnP1.name: Mucus Trail
3s66FP7raqgSCnP1.description: Any square the giant slug moves into is coated in mucus. These spaces are difficult terrain, and any creature that moves into one or ends its turn in one is subjected to the slug's mucus. After an hour, the mucus dries and the area is no longer difficult terrain.

Giant Solifugid.name: Giant Solifugid
Giant Solifugid.publicNotes:
The smallest of giant solifugids are still large enough to harry desert traders and their mounts.

These monstrous vermin have six legs and two large feeding appendages easily mistaken for an additional pair of legs. They are often called camel spiders, sun spiders, or wind scorpions, despite the fact that they are neither spiders nor scorpions.

hEsUevgpSNSIcNzB.name: Pounce
hEsUevgpSNSIcNzB.description: The giant solifugid Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the giant solifugid began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Giant Squid.name: Giant Squid
Giant Squid.publicNotes: Dwelling deep within the oceans, this huge cephalopod grows up to 45 feet in length and can weigh up to 600 pounds. Its arms and tentacles are lined with hundreds of hooks and suckers, allowing it to seize its prey with ease.

GSglY8uncoV8v0jg.name: Jet
GSglY8uncoV8v0jg.description: The giant squid moves up to 200 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering any reactions.

dO0urnF4xfwl5Yp8.name: Ravenous Embrace
dO0urnF4xfwl5Yp8.description: The giant squid makes up to four arm Strikes, each with a different arm and against a different target. The giant squid then makes a beak Strike against one creature that it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} during Ravenous Embrace. Each arm Strike counts separately for the squid's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until the squid has made all of its arm Strikes; the beak Strike uses the multiple attack penalty as normal.

Giant Tick.name: Giant Tick
Giant Tick.publicNotes: This grotesque tick is the size of a dog and scurries with surprising speed.

UHFNjGmcb7jCzvBE.name: Attach
UHFNjGmcb7jCzvBE.description: When the giant tick Strikes a creature larger than itself, its barbed hypostome attaches it to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the giant tick moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The giant tick is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} while attached. If the giant tick is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature on which it has used Blood Drain, that creature takes [[/r {1}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}. Escaping the attachment or removing the giant tick in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

eOpB0SxDMEU65Oyy.name: Blood Drain
eOpB0SxDMEU65Oyy.description:
Requirements The giant tick is attached to a creature

Effect The giant tick uses its hypostome to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals [[/r 1d4]] damage, and the giant tick gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a giant tick is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Giant Toad.name: Giant Toad
Giant Toad.publicNotes: Most giant toads live in dry environments, particularly deserts, and eagerly eat almost any creature smaller than themselves. They're known to eat giant rats, then take over the rats' burrows as homes. Giant toads have large poison glands behind their eyes that enable them to coat their skin with poison. This leads to them having very few natural predators, and populations can quickly explode if left unchecked. While most consider giant toads dangerous pests, some groups of ogres and hill giants cultivate them to collect their poison for recreational use.

AhfsEZ9fBUS6e02P.name: Poisonous Warts
AhfsEZ9fBUS6e02P.description: Any creature that hits the giant toad with an unarmed Strike or otherwise touches the toad is exposed to giant toad poison.

KQBI90QlI48BEPP3.name: Giant Toad Poison
KQBI90QlI48BEPP3.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

tmi63gM84pc6s5qK.name: Tongue Grab
tmi63gM84pc6s5qK.description:
A creature hit by the giant toad's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the giant toad. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the toad's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful Strike against AC 15 that deals at least 6 slashing damage.

This deals no damage to the toad but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Giant Whiptail Centipede.name: Giant Whiptail Centipede
Giant Whiptail Centipede.publicNotes: Whiptail centipedes are sleek and swift tunnel predators.

U69lb7BfCPLfTsfG.name: 借机攻击(仅限甩尾) Attack of Opportunity (Tail Only)

gd4pTa9mCV6qrbcN.name: Undulate
gd4pTa9mCV6qrbcN.description: The giant whiptail centipede Strides or Steps. During this movement, it can pass through spaces as narrow as 5 feet without Squeezing.

JTKyH2bv7vq73eF0.name: Whiptail Centipede Venom
JTKyH2bv7vq73eF0.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d10}[poison]]]{2d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Giant Wolverine.name: Giant Wolverine
Giant Wolverine.publicNotes: Giant wolverines grow to the approximate size of horses and claim even more expansive territories than their more diminutive wolverine cousins. While a smaller wolverine will defend its prey from armed humanoids, a giant wolverine is unafraid to stalk and kill such creatures.

nKM6FVNsXbBwEPNq.name: Gnaw
nKM6FVNsXbBwEPNq.description:
Requirements The wolverine has a creature grabbed from its jaws Strike

Effect The wolverine chews violently on the creature, dealing [[/r {2d6}[piercing]]]{2d6 piercing damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save also takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d6.success].

YdcYSwBDfJFctOhL.name: Pounce
YdcYSwBDfJFctOhL.description: The giant wolverine Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the giant wolverine begins this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the attack.

jzbdXMuXge2oT2ol.name: Wolverine Rage
jzbdXMuXge2oT2ol.description:
The giant wolverine enters a state of pure rage that lasts either for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first. While raging, the giant wolverine has AC 20, its jaws Strike deals 2d6+11 damage, and its claw Strike deals 2d4+11 damage. While raging, the giant wolverine can't use actions that have the concentrate trait, except for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}.

After it's stopped raging, a giant wolverine can't use Wolverine Rage again for 1 minute.

Glass Golem.name: Glass Golem
Glass Golem.publicNotes:
Crafted of hardened glass and held together by magically treated lead, glass golems are both deadly guardians and works of exquisite art. Glass golems most often protect grand cathedrals or opulent palaces-testaments to the wealth and power of those they serve, or once served. Once spurred into action by the commands of their creators, glass golems are quicker and more agile than most other golems. Their sharp, blade-like limbs can easily sever veins and arteries, creating wounds that bleed profusely.

Of all the various types of golems, the glass golem is the one most akin to a work of art. Just as powerful aristocrats might use an ice golem for temperature regulation or a wood golem as an ego-boosting statue, a glass golem's colorful glass construction can elevate the beauty of any chamber by its mere presence.

kcRvfKLlgq9sdmsj.name: Golem Antimagic
kcRvfKLlgq9sdmsj.description:
harmed by sonic ([[/r 6d6]], [[/r 2d6]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by fire (area [[/r 2d6]] HP); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as “cold and water”), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/r 2d6]] rounds instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

LwBTFYgYLRf8gXzt.name: Spell Reflection
LwBTFYgYLRf8gXzt.description:
Trigger The glass golem is targeted by a spell

Effect The glass golem positions its magical, reflective surfaces to turn the spell back on the caster. It tries to counteract the spell by attempting an Acrobatics check for its counteract check. If it successfully counteract the spell, the effect is turned back on the caster.

4cuSJxJLUg7icXmj.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
