4cuSJxJLUg7icXmj.description: A glass golem is affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell as though the golem were an unattended object.

lQZGx8hWnzcG2R6l.name: Dazzling Brilliance
lQZGx8hWnzcG2R6l.description:
The glass golem creates waves of scintillating luminosity that cast bright light in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] (and dim light for the next 60 feet). The light lasts until the start of the glass golem's next turn, after which the glass golem can't use Dazzling Brilliance for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. A creature within the bright light or that enters the bright light must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:23] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and then dazzled for an additional 4 rounds.

Gorgon.name: Gorgon
Gorgon.publicNotes:
Though they may resemble constructs to the untrained eye due to their metallic, interlocking armor plates that look and feel like polished stone, gorgons are a creature of flesh and bone. These ill-tempered beasts greet interlopers with a charge or trample accompanied with belches of petrifying breath. Gorgons are dangerous on their own, and when they band together in herds, they become especially deadly.

Gorgons typically subsist on petrified flesh or fossils. These supernatural beasts can gain sustenance from natural stone if they must, though they find raw stone flavorless, so it's not a preferred food source. In battle, gorgons use their petrifying breath to turn their prey into stone. They break up the resulting statues with their hooves or horns and swallow the stony chunks with loud chewing bites. Gorgons cannot digest unpetrified organic material, and if they try, they experience sickness and great gastrointestinal peril. Such discomforts are not life threatening to gorgons, but they do make the creatures even more ill tempered than usual-much to the chagrin of anyone they subsequently encounter.

Gorgon flesh tastes vaguely like beef, but with a gritty, earthy texture and aftertaste that most meat connoisseurs find off-putting. Creatures with a close association to earth and stone are more likely to find the flavor appetizing; stone giants in particular consider gorgon steaks to be delicacies. Some cultures, notably dwarven cultures, consider the preparation of gorgon for meals as both a physical and a culinary challenge. Chefs who work with gorgon flesh can find renown for their skill in creating palatable dishes from such naturally unpalatable meat.

OC4UGWpbAZyLbFb6.name: Breath Weapon
OC4UGWpbAZyLbFb6.description:
The gorgon breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of green gas. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save.

The gorgon can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns.

Critical Failure The creature becomes petrified permanently.

Stt8YZwfNCRzNgkQ.name: Powerful Charge
Stt8YZwfNCRzNgkQ.description: The gorgon Strides twice, then makes a horn Strike. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the Strike's damage is increased to 3d12+12.

Gosreg.name: Gosreg
Gosreg.publicNotes:
Gosregs are agents of the Dominion of the Black that insinuate themselves into humanoid societies to foster the goals of their sinister alien masters. They act as spies and special forces that can mingle with humanoid society while enacting plans for the rest of the Dominion in secret.

In their natural forms, gosregs dart about in a jerky gallop due to their stumpy legs and gangly arms. They take on the appearances of humanoids to infiltrate societies, and they drop their disguises only when they feel they are ultimately compromised and must resort to physical violence to protect their agendas. Their brain-like heads and bestial legs suggest a potential link with a similar Dominion of the Black agent: the dreaded intellect devourer.
Gosreg.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

PYpTwTM9SFGR0Vc5.name: 梦魇术 Nightmare
PYpTwTM9SFGR0Vc5.description:
你向目标送去一段恼人的噩梦。在目标下一次入睡时，它必须尝试一次意志豁免。如果你知道目标的名字但是从未遇见过它，目标在意志豁免上获得+4环境加值。

大成功 目标不承受任何负面效果，并暂时免疫1星期。

成功 目标经历了噩梦，但不会承受除了糟糕回忆以外的负面效果。

失败 目标经历噩梦，并且在醒来时 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}。

大失败 目标经历噩梦，醒来时疲乏，并且获得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2} 直到不再疲乏。

WKWzTrWyiPJNihmZ.name: 思维感知 Thoughtsense
WKWzTrWyiPJNihmZ.description: The gosreg senses a creature's mental essence as a precise sense with the listed range; it cannot sense mindless creatures with thoughtsense.

qoqJdxMXA4DPeMal.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

UIgdlwmkkFjjq6Kl.name: Unsettled Aura
UIgdlwmkkFjjq6Kl.description:
30 feet.

Gosregs project a field of discordant energy that unsettles the minds of thinking creatures. Any non-mindless creature within 30 feet of a gosreg takes a -1 status penalty to Will saves.

Fp4obYTKAlnrpeFi.name: Change Shape
Fp4obYTKAlnrpeFi.description:
The gosreg takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

pTowxMM6c9JCvVGF.name: Mind Bolt
pTowxMM6c9JCvVGF.description: A gosreg concentrates its field of discordant mental energy and projects it into the mind of an enemy within 60 feet. The target takes [[/r {6d6}[mental]]]{6d6 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:30|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Granite Glyptodont.name: Granite Glyptodont
Granite Glyptodont.publicNotes: This squat and stony creature looks like an armadillo with a large raised back and a flail-like tail. The granite glyptodont has no true need to feed, as with all elementals, yet it does seem to linger after transforming the flesh of those it calcifies, as if the mere proximity of flesh fossilizing into stone pleases it somehow.

2VxyCqJZcASXlsyq.name: Calcification
2VxyCqJZcASXlsyq.description:
A blow from a granite glyptodont's tail hardens the flesh of the creature struck. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). Further failed saves against calcification increase the value of the slowed condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by calcification, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}. If the creature isn't petrified, the slowed conditions end once 1 minute passes without the creature failing a save against calcification.

Every 24 hours after it was petrified, the creature can attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save to recover. On a success, it becomes flesh again, but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for the next 24 hours. On a critical success, the creature recovers and isn't slowed. On a failure, the creature remains petrified, but can try again in 24 hours. On a critical failure, the petrification is permanent, and the creature can't attempt any more saves.

hwZzmzZjVpUb64cH.name: Earth Glide
hwZzmzZjVpUb64cH.description: A granite glyptodont can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Gray Ooze.name: Gray Ooze
Gray Ooze.publicNotes: These dangerous oozes are the bane of any who travel through swamps, marshes, or damp caves. Easily masquerading as pools of clear water or patches of wet stone, gray oozes lie in wait for unwary victims to reach down for a drink or step into what appears to be a puddle, then lash out with whiplike pseudopods to ensnare and consume their hapless prey.

vApfqAgqE1h1XDQe.name: Motion Sense
vApfqAgqE1h1XDQe.description: A gray ooze can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

xgpvgBd8BjAbDY4N.name: Puddled Ambush
xgpvgBd8BjAbDY4N.description:
Trigger A creature enters a space occupied by a gray ooze

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The gray ooze automatically notices the creature, then makes a pseudopod Strike against one creature adjacent to itself before rolling initiative.

2wgeHmf6T4ScZpAk.name: Gray Ooze Acid
2wgeHmf6T4ScZpAk.description: A gray ooze's acid damages only metal and organic materials, not stone.

Green Dracolisk.name: Green Dracolisk
Green Dracolisk.publicNotes: Dracolisks are rare magical crossbreeds of chromatic dragons and basilisks. None now know how they first came to be, but they have proven viable and can breed with one another as well as with basilisks. While a dracolisk appears much like a young true dragon of its parent type, its eight legs are an immediate indication that it is something more. Its coloration varies, depending on the nature of its draconic ancestry, though it's lighter on its underside and darker near its wing tips. A typical dracolisk is 15 feet long and weighs 3,000 pounds.

5RsDoTAVa9W8gKnx.name: Draconic Resistance
5RsDoTAVa9W8gKnx.description: A dracolisk has resistance 10 to the type of damage it produces with its breath weapon.

dZoSOjCNPr4EIzGG.name: Petrifying Glance
dZoSOjCNPr4EIzGG.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the dracolisk can see starts its turn

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as its body stiffens.

KQAihkBcgo2L9lGv.name: Breath Weapon
KQAihkBcgo2L9lGv.description:
The dracolisk breathes a gout of energy based on its draconic heritage, as noted below. This breath weapon deals [[/r {6d10}[poison]]]{6d10 poison damage}, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save.

The dracolisk can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Black @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of poison

BQDQsCBmg1gB3VSr.name: Petrifying Gaze
BQDQsCBmg1gB3VSr.description:
The dracolisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save. If it fails and has not already been slowed by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. If the creature already was slowed by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently.

A creature petrified in this manner can be instantly restored to flesh by being coated (not just splashed) with fresh dracolisk or basilisk blood no more than 1 hour old. A single dracolisk contains enough blood to coat [[/r 1d4+2 #Medium creatures]] Medium creatures in this manner.

OUEVYrICDhOs5NML.name: Savage Jaws
OUEVYrICDhOs5NML.description: The dracolisk makes a single Strike with its jaws. If the attack hits, it deals [[/r {4d12+16}[piercing]]]{4d12+16 piercing damage} (versatile S). This counts as two attacks for its multiple attack penalty.

Grendel.name: Grendel
Grendel.publicNotes:
This reaver of the cold marsh is not just a monster; he is a force of nature. Where there is peace and prosperity in the world, Grendel strikes, eager to prove that tranquility is transitory and death is the only constant. He stalks the edge of his fens, seeking settlements where joy holds sway. He strikes under cover of night, primarily targeting celebrations or festivals. The more happiness or joy he can extinguish, the better.

Although Grendel is a unique creature, killing him won't save the world from his ravages for long. Once Grendel's mother instinctively feels the pain of her violent son's death, she soon births a replacement. The new Grendel seems to avoid the sites his elder brothers terrorized, as if he instinctively knows that such a place hosts heroes powerful enough to defeat him.

u7R9PDTQDTEJeQAX.name: Keen Hearing
u7R9PDTQDTEJeQAX.description: Grendel's hearing is a precise sense to a range of 120 feet.

g9enKXrvCUkwck8W.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
g9enKXrvCUkwck8W.description:
Grendel gains an extra reaction at the start of each of his turns that he can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with his claw. He can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

5djM8sO4U2PY23bG.name: Unstoppable
5djM8sO4U2PY23bG.description:
Trigger Grendel would take @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage} or gain one of the following conditions: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}

Effect The persistent damage or condition from the triggering effect doesn't affect Grendel.

PSqd8jopT7V35lJt.name: Hands of the Murderer
PSqd8jopT7V35lJt.description: Grendel's fist Strikes deal 18 bludgeoning damage on a failure (but no damage on a critical failure).

P5tslJuQziddpFpV.name: Tooth Grind
P5tslJuQziddpFpV.description:
Requirements Grendel is grabbing a creature

Effect Grendel makes a bludgeoning jaws Strike against the creature he's grabbing. On a hit, the creature also takes [[/r 2d6]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage} and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 1}, or increases its wounded value by 1 if already wounded. On a critical hit, the creature instead becomes wounded 2, or increases its wounded value by 2 if already wounded. If a creature dies from Tooth Grind, Grendel regains 40 HP; this is a healing effect.

Grimstalker.name: Grimstalker
Grimstalker.publicNotes:
These violently murderous fey have one purpose: to stealthily hunt down and slay humanoids brazen enough to dare set foot in the wilderness. Though they prefer to hunt from the shadows, grimstalkers do not fear taking their grisly work to the very edges of civilization. This boldness serves as a reminder that nature can be cruel, capricious, and owes no debt to humanity. Grimstalkers are happy to perform nature's dirty work and particularly enjoy targeting loggers, hunters, and explorers, regardless of whether they respect the natural setting they work or travel within.

Grimstalkers are gaunt and hairless, and their mottled, green and brown flesh gives them the appearance of moss-draped bark. When damaged, they bleed a thick, sap-like blood. They mark their territories by lopping off the heads of their victims and stringing them up in the surrounding trees, a practice that often lures dangerous scavengers into their lands. Carnivorous and thorny plants are often found in wilds where grimstalkers dwell, filling roles that pets might in human society, though grimstalkers tend to treat these "pets" poorly at best.

There are few accounts of grimstalkers working with other fey-for the most part, grimstalkers see their kin from the First World as cowards or weaklings, or perhaps both. Even notoriously violent fey such as redcaps shy from them, as grimstalkers consider their own kind the only company worth keeping.

Grimstalkers hunt in small bands, using stealth to approach their targets. They surround enemies first, then work to unnerve them by knocking on trees or howling out threats in Aklo to distract and panic their quarry. Of course, a band of grimstalkers won't stay together for long, quickly succumbing to bickering and infighting. These violent arguments are common pastimes among grimstalkers, often ending with each grimstalker going its own way. Not even the presence of more powerful fey or commanding creatures can keep grimstalkers from their predisposed bickering. Some scholars theorize that this quality speaks to an ancient curse that once afflicted fey who were judged too cantankerous, but in truth, it's just part of what makes a grimstalker what it is: ill-tempered, confrontational, and bitter.

bKkmonWLmkkxYnh2.name: Camouflage
bKkmonWLmkkxYnh2.description: A grimstalker can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in natural environments, even if it doesn't have cover.

vKcQxEXLQx45iyeq.name: Grimstalker Sap
vKcQxEXLQx45iyeq.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round),

Stage 3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

brun3T7XF65PG2xu.name: Woodland Stride
brun3T7XF65PG2xu.description: A grimstalker can always find a path, almost as if foliage parts before it. A grimstalker ignores difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede its progress.

Grindylow.name: Grindylow
Grindylow.publicNotes:
The top half of a grindylow looks vaguely like that of a goblin, but from the waist down, their bodies split into a tangle of suckered, wriggling tentacles. They dwell mostly in shallow waters both fresh and briny, including lakes, rivers, coastal regions, and near coral reefs. Grindylows generally organize into schools ranging from a few individuals to a few hundred. Smaller schools can sometimes be brought under the leadership of a powerful aquatic creature, though such alliances last only until the school faces a major setback, at which point the surviving grindylows scatter and form smaller schools of their own.

Grindylows aren't territorial, but they are pragmatic; while they rarely build permanent structures, they will adopt a good hunting ground for generations until driven away by predators. They often lair in mobile shelters, such as a sargasso of seaweed or the hull of an abandoned ship. They are skilled scavengers and hunters that eat anything they can sink their teeth into.

Grindylows respect the power of bigger sea predators but have a special hatred for squids (or anything they believe looks like a squid). Sailors plying grindylow-infested waters often paint the images of squids on the bottoms of their hulls in hopes of warding the little terrors off. While this can keep smaller schools at bay, it can also backfire, potentially inciting larger groups to gather for a coordinated attack; this becomes especially more likely if the ship's route becomes predictable. This hatred of squids does not extend to other tentacled creatures; grindylows consider octopuses to be the epitome of grace and power.

nplfqbEUtcOBlV0b.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
nplfqbEUtcOBlV0b.description:
A grindylow gains 1 extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with a tentacle. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same choice.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

T7L2FMHmpDoURw0s.name: Clinging Suckers
T7L2FMHmpDoURw0s.description: When a grindylow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grabs} a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it. If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} while it is attached to a creature.

ftJSskhqjZaMBNyZ.name: Jet
ftJSskhqjZaMBNyZ.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.

Grippli Scout.name: Grippli Scout
Grippli Scout.publicNotes:
Gripplis make their homes in the treetops of tropical jungles and forests. These frog-like humanoids are uniquely adapted to their environment, with oversized eyes that give them keen vision in both light and dark and large toes that allow them to easily scale trees. Gripplis vary widely in physical appearance, with their physiologies influenced by their surrounding environment. Those who live in verdant forests, for example, typically have bright green skin and red eyes. In contrast, gripplis who live in regions of rot and decay have mottled-brown coloration, and those who dwell near lakes or streams may bear bright blue and orange stripes. Typical gripplis stand just over 2 feet tall and weigh approximately 30 pounds.

Whatever region they come from, gripplis tend to be peaceful hunter-gatherers. Due to their modest understanding of agriculture, gripplis don't maintain typical farms like other humanoids do. Rather, they cultivate mushroom patches and gather a wide array of fruits from the surrounding wilderness. While most gripplis hunt insects, some societies also capture and breed them, nurturing herds of giant dragonflies or beetles that they eventually slaughter for food. Particularly enterprising gripplis might even seek out and tame larger flying insects to use as mounts during their hunts. The rearing of such massive insects is no easy feat, however, so gripplis who manage to do so are often heralded as local heroes.

Gripplis usually construct their villages in particularly dense copses, stringing thin rope bridges between wide wooden platforms built around each trunk. They make use of broad leaves and thick branches to further obscure their villages, making them especially difficult to spot from the forest floor, and riddle the surrounding forest with labyrinthine trails that only they can navigate.

Grippli scouts typically keep watch on the outskirts of grippli settlements. More potent gripplis inhabit the settlements, be they religious leaders, powerful druids, or agile warriors that, due to their small size, focus more on finesse weapons and ranged attacks than on melee tactics.

IwPCTJvgvDQC90Yj.name: Hurl Net
IwPCTJvgvDQC90Yj.description:
Requirements The grippli is wielding a net in two hands

Effect The grippli makes a ranged Strike (with a +9 modifier) against a Medium or smaller creature within 20 feet. On a hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} instead. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the net is 16. A creature adjacent to the target can Interact with the net to remove it.

kziZybKPrc34cUoX.name: Jungle Stride
kziZybKPrc34cUoX.description: Gripplis ignore difficult terrain in forests and jungles.

Grodair.name: Grodair
Grodair.publicNotes:
Grodairs are bizarre fishlike creature native to the First World. Their supernatural physiology includes a strange organ with an extradimensional space capable of storing thousands of gallons of water. This grants grodairs the ability to create a suitable environment for themselves anywhere by releasing the water, quickly transforming any surrounding land into a shallow bog. When grodairs wish to leave for a new location, they simply suck up all the water back up. When necessary, grodairs can also travel on land by walking upon the tangle of long, fleshy tentacles that dangle from their bellies.

Grodairs have two sets of eyes that function independently. While this makes the creatures difficult to surprise, it also makes them easy to distract. During conversations, they have a tendency to lose focus quickly and have difficulty remembering things. Still, they are avid conversationalists and enjoy hearing tales about the world. While this quality makes grodairs quite likable, they aren't reliable. They have difficulty following plans or schedules, and they can keep a secret only if they happen to forget it first. For these reasons, grodairs don't always make the best allies.

Grodairs are voracious and curious omnivores who love trying new foods-in fact, the pursuit of new and interesting food is the most common reason that they venture out of First World. They can also capture and store within their throats any small animals and plants easily suspended in water, and eject them for consumption at a later time.

P48WRIeVuuAB8JWK.name: Death Flood
P48WRIeVuuAB8JWK.description: When a grodair dies, its body explodes in a blast of pressurized water that deals [[/r {4d6}[bludgeoning]]]{4d6 bludgeoning damage} to creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save is pushed 5 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).

8J1VrbhC0fQxs0Xu.name: Muddy Field
8J1VrbhC0fQxs0Xu.description: The grodair transforms all soil, sand, or similar sediment in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] into mud for 1 round. This mud is difficult terrain for creatures other than grodairs.

HAh9hAsU8XCNWPOU.name: Organ of Endless Water
HAh9hAsU8XCNWPOU.description: The grodair causes water to pour from a magical sac on its spine, either a stream of water at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or a fountain in a 5-foot-long stream at a rate of 5 gallons per round. It can stop the flow of water as a single action.

Gylou.name: Gylou
Gylou.publicNotes: Though gylous are deeply entrenched in the expansive and complex machinations of Hell, they are highly skilled agents capable of nuanced diplomacy, masterful deception, physical finesse, and nearly any other tasks they set their minds to. This versatility has led to gylous becoming widespread throughout all layers of Hell, enabling them to filter key information to their masters regarding other devils' plots and schemes. Their allegiance is no secret, but their skills are so great that powerful devils employ one or more gylous regardless. While most gylous have a feminine form (combined with their role, this is the source of their common moniker of "handmaiden"), some have other gender presentations, and nearly all gylous take on carefully cultivated illusions to best suit the roles they fill. More often than not, gylous arise when lesser devils who have demonstrated exceptional utility and invaluable skills are uplifted into a new form, though on rare occasions they are shaped from the souls of evil mortals who showed unparalleled savvy within bureaucratic enterprises.
Gylou.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

pZNjrGx8hawqDqpa.name: 真视术(恒定法术) True Seeing (Constant)
pZNjrGx8hawqDqpa.description: 你可以看见60尺内的事物的本来面貌。GM秘密骰反制检定，对抗区域中的所有幻术或者变形效果，但这只会决定你是否能看破它（例如，如果该检定成功对抗了一个变形法术，你可以看见该生物的本来形态，但你不会结束该变形法术）。

bkk440fw7A5zFFVh.name: 幻象造物(随意施法) Illusory Object (At will)
bkk440fw7A5zFFVh.description:
你创造一个固定物体的视觉幻象。该幻象必须能完全处于法术区域中。该物体会自然活动，但是不会发出声音或者产生气味。举例而言，幻象瀑布中会出现水并流下，但是它会是安静的。

当生物触摸幻像，或者使用搜索（Seek）动作来检查它时，该生物可以尝试不相信你的幻术。

升阶 (2环级) 你的幻象也会发出合适的声音，产生正常气味，并且摸起来也很正常。该法术获得听觉特征。该持续时间增加到1小时。

升阶 (5环级) 如2环级，但是持续时间为无限。

PvAhmTacSiuheD52.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At will)
PvAhmTacSiuheD52.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

ZXR3Dqh3vpkb4MJB.name: 注目术(随意施法) Enthrall (At will)
ZXR3Dqh3vpkb4MJB.description:
你的言语令目标迷魂。你在施法和持续时间中持续演说或者歌唱。注意到你的演说或者歌唱的目标可能会失去注意力；每个目标必须尝试一次意志豁免。如果目标的信仰，族裔，政治观念对立，或者其他它不远认同你的说法的情况，GM可能赋予一个环境加值（最大为+4）。

在你维持法术时，每个进入射程的生物必须尝试一次豁免。如果你在演说，注目术获得语言特征。

大成功 目标不受影响，并且注意到你尝试使用魔法。

成功 目标不必注意，但是也没发现你在使用魔法（他也许发现其他人被注目术影响）。

失败 目标对你 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}。当它发现其不认同的行为或者说法时，它可以尝试另一次意志豁免。如果它成功，他不再迷魂，并且暂时免疫1小时。如果目标成为敌对行为的目标，或者其他生物对其尝试交涉或者威吓，迷魂会立即结束。

大失败 如同失败，但是目标不会在其不认同你时尝试豁免以结束迷魂。

Gsx5q76S7ZPL3iXd.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

ESiP5kSLjg2exhAh.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

oqYW7IkKIsygycAY.name: Reflexive Grab
oqYW7IkKIsygycAY.description:
Trigger A creature leaves a square within the gylou's reach using a move action or attempts a melee Strike against the gylou

Effect The gylou lashes out with a tentacle, attempting to Grapple the triggering creature. If the triggering Strike was with a melee weapon, the attacking creature can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.wQYmDStjdjn0I26t]{Release} the weapon to cause the gylou to automatically fail the Athletics check.

nLocPM8hKYMstnGr.name: Change Shape
nLocPM8hKYMstnGr.description:
The gylou adopts the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage modifiers of their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

LZTLNHZnYh3Eg4aU.name: Indispensable Savvy
LZTLNHZnYh3Eg4aU.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The gylou attempts a skill check but hasn't rolled yet

Effect The gylou demonstrates a preternatural ability for the task at hand. They use their Deception modifier for the triggering check and for all skill checks using the same skill thereafter until the next time the gylou uses this ability or until 24 hours have passed, whichever happens first.

RTUQPDiCd9wKvFow.name: Tentacle Encage
RTUQPDiCd9wKvFow.description:
Requirements The gylou has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The gylou transfers the grabbed creature into their lower body's net of encaging tentacles, freeing their limbs and tentacles to make Strikes. This has the same effects as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow Whole} (Medium, [[/r {2d12+12}[bludgeoning]]]{2d12+12 bludgeoning damage}, Rupture 30), except the encaged creature is not at risk of suffocation, and the gylou can bring the encaged creature with them when they cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door}. A gylou can have only one creature encaged at a time.

Hadrosaurid.name: Hadrosaurid
Hadrosaurid.publicNotes:
Hadrosaurids are a broad grouping of herbivorous dinosaurs that share characteristic flat snouts filled with rows of grinding teeth well suited for feeding on vegetation. Also known as "duck-billed dinosaurs" due to the unusual shape of their jaws, hadrosaurids are lumbering creatures that can rival an elephant for size, although they tend to be much less aggressive and are prone to flight when confronted with danger rather than stubbornly standing their ground. Many species of hadrosaurids have uniquely shaped crests on their heads that give each species its own unusual profile, making them easily recognizable even to an amateur dinosaur watcher.

Giants and other oversized creatures have been known to domesticate hadrosaurids to serve as livestock. Despite their ability to sprint quickly, they don't make particularly viable mounts due to their timid natures, but in a large group, a panicked gathering of hadrosaurids can wreak great damage with their trampling.

A hadrosaurid can walk for short distances on its hind legs but prefers to graze and travel on all fours. The typical hadrosaurid is 20 to 30 feet long and can weigh up to 10,000 pounds.

qfIg2ulL65DhV6X2.name: Sprint
qfIg2ulL65DhV6X2.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The hadrosaurid Strides twice. It has a +20-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these Strides.

Hamatula.name: Hamatula
Hamatula.publicNotes: Hamatulas are forged in Erebus to protect infernal vaults from those foolish enough to try to rob the archdevil Mammon. In case the vicious spines protruding from their bodies and ability to teleport weren't deadly enough, they are also clever wielders of warding glyphs. They are effective conjured guardians, though they resent being pulled away from their duties in Hell. Unlike most fiends, hamatulas are formed from several souls that lack any features distinctive enough to merit another role.
Hamatula.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

g0gdzzzvux4ApSD5.name: 守卫刻文(随意施法) Glyph of Warding (At will)
g0gdzzzvux4ApSD5.description:
你通过将敌对法术记入一个符号，制造了一个陷阱。当施放该法术时，你也施放一个更低环级的法术并存入刻文中。该储存的法术施放必须花费3个或者更少的动作，具有敌对效果，并且以一个生物为目标或者具有一个区域。你可以为刻文设定一个密语，一个触发器，或者均设定。任何生物移动，开启，或者接触目标容器，或者进入了目标区域时，没有说出密语或者激活刻文的触发条件，均会施放内存的伤害法术。

当一个法术被存于刻文内后，刻文获得该法术的所有特征。如果存储的法术以一个或者更多生物为目标，它以引发刻文的生物为目标。如果该法术具有区域，该区域以引发刻文的生物为中心。守卫刻文的持续时间在刻文被触发时结束。该刻文视为魔法陷阱，使用你的法术DC作为发现它所需的察觉检定DC以及解除它所需的盗窃（Thievery）检定DC；这两种检定均要求进行尝试的生物为受训才可能成功。

你可以解消守卫刻文。你同时可以生效的守卫刻文数量等于你的施法属性调整值。

y8TePj5x2rTRtyMK.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At will)
y8TePj5x2rTRtyMK.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

t8ToZMzymYUk47az.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

WJHihy42QBNSUonW.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

nQuUyJS1AvKyFrA0.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity
nQuUyJS1AvKyFrA0.description:
Barb only. A hamatula gains an extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action. In addition to the normal trigger, a hamatula can make an Attack of Opportunity against a creature that touches it or an adjacent creature that attempts a melee Strike against it.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

BVXX982lJiCTVido.name: Bloodletting
BVXX982lJiCTVido.description: On a critical hit, the hamatula's barbs deal @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed3d6.success].

UuUlz5A5IwoGhe6n.name: Frightful Strike
UuUlz5A5IwoGhe6n.description:
Trigger The hamatula hits a creature with a barb Strike

Effect The creature struck must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of its saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Frightful Strike for 24 hours.

vMYnNlSJnYJepYe8.name: Impaling Barb
vMYnNlSJnYJepYe8.description: The hamatula makes a barb Strike, then Strides up to half its Speed without triggering reactions. If the Strike hits, the hamatula impales the target with one of its barbs and snaps the barb free as it moves away from the target. This deals an additional [[/r {2d8}[piercing]]]{2d8 piercing damage} to the target and pins it to an adjacent surface, rendering it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} (Escape DC 29).

QK7BnQXUv5A7jm84.name: Warden of Erebus
QK7BnQXUv5A7jm84.description: A hamatula's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.o0l57UfBm9ScEUMW]{Glyph of Warding} innate spell can contain any common spell from the Core Rulebook that meets the criteria in glyph of warding; the hamatula doesn't need to provide the spell.

Hellcat.name: Hellcat
Hellcat.publicNotes:
Hellcats are devious predators native to the fiery pits of Hell. While the fiendish creatures appears as skeletal smilodons, their bones smoking with heat and dripping with boiling blood, they are not undead. They are living hellspawn with transparent flesh that reveals their burning skeletons. A typical hellcat is 9 feet long and weighs 1,000 pounds.

Left to their own devices, hellcats spend their time hunting-that is, seeking and stalking prey just for the thrill of the chase. As fiendish creatures, they do not require mortal sustenance, but they do devour their prey for the sheer pleasure of inflicting pain. They are also far more intelligent than most assume, and they resent being treated as unintelligent animals; those who treat a hellcat as a one may find themself made into a trophy for its pack, as a hellcat goes to great lengths to coordinate elaborate revenge upon those who fail to show proper respect.

Though they can't speak, hellcats know Infernal and can communicate by telepathy with any creature capable of speech. They rarely say much except to make whispered threats and to acknowledge the orders of their diabolic masters.

Hellcats are quick to retreat if they are clearly outmatched or up against foes they're unable to reach, but they never forget prey that escapes them. They often track potential victims and recruit allies, including other hellcats, to make coordinated attacks or ambushes against their foes.
Hellcat.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Hellcat.languages: Can't Speak Any Language, Telepathy 100 feet

oC5vZAEFIISSmofG.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

ubj0ypG0da0nRirb.name: Fade into the Light
ubj0ypG0da0nRirb.description:
Trigger The hellcat begins its turn in bright light

Effect The hellcat becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until its no longer in bright light. If the hellcat uses a hostile action, the invisibility ends after that hostile action is completed.

eKrrD4BYO7xl9vPo.name: Fearful Attack
eKrrD4BYO7xl9vPo.description: The hellcat deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} creatures.

8Mkj5lFXbki11UgV.name: Infernal Mindlink
8Mkj5lFXbki11UgV.description:
The hellcat telepathically link its senses to all other hellcats within 100 feet for 10 minutes. It loses this contact with any hellcat that moves out of a 100-foot radius.

While linked to at least one ally, the hellcat can't be flanked and gains a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws.

mgA0es28Vb0TAr40.name: Menacing Growl
mgA0es28Vb0TAr40.description:
The hellcat produces a low growl to disorient and frighten foes. The hellcat can cause this vocalization to originate from somewhere else within 30 feet. Non-fiends in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save.

The hellcat can't issue another Menacing Growl for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

HT78d5cKcguY6IcL.name: Pounce
HT78d5cKcguY6IcL.description: The hellcat Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the hellcat began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the ability's Strike.

Hezrou.name: Hezrou
Hezrou.publicNotes: Hezrous dwell in the vast and endless Abyssal swamps, mires, and waterways and are equally at home on land and in the water. A hezrou's presence has an obvious effect on nearby flora and water, causing plant life to twist and knot and infusing water with a foul odor and brackish taste-signs much easier to spot on the Material Plane than in the Abyss. Long exposure to this corruption can cause vile transformations and hideous mutations, and entire miserable communities of corrupted creatures sometimes rise in swamplands where a hezrou dwells. Hezrous themselves prefer simple pleasures, and they often waste their considerable intellect in the pursuit of comfortable places to slumber, squealing meals to eat, or objects of beauty to deface. They do not seek out cults to fawn over them but will not turn away those who seek to worship on their own. Hezrous form from the souls of those who abused and polluted their environs or neighbors, either through the introduction of toxins to the region or the insidious spread of drugs and poisons through a society.

DbvMliTitDLEnD8H.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At will)
DbvMliTitDLEnD8H.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

5FQFNi5wNLjJfVVi.name: 神圣狂怒(随意施法) Divine Wrath (At will)
5FQFNi5wNLjJfVVi.description:
你引导你的神祇的怒火，攻击对立阵营的敌人。选择一个你的神祇具有的阵营。（混乱，邪恶，善良，或者秩序）。如果你没有神祇，或者你的神祇是绝对中立，你无法施放该法术。该法术具有你选择的阵营的特征。你造成你所选阵营类型的4d10伤害；每个区域中的生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免。对应你所选阵营的生物不受影响。既不对应也不对立的生物将其豁免骰结果视为更好一级。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害。

失败 该生物承受完整伤害，并且 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

大失败 该生物承受全部伤害，并且 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}; 当其恶心时，也会 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

升阶 (+1) 该伤害增加1d10。

ghbtjQahExs1AvpE.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

fZOolgYWKm1a27op.name: Purity Vulnerability
fZOolgYWKm1a27op.description: A hezrou revels in the foulness it exudes and becomes distraught when contaminations are purified. The first time in a round when a contamination is purified (such as via purify food and drink) or a toxin is neutralized (such as via neutralize poison) within 30 feet of a hezrou, the demon takes [[/r {6d6}[mental]]]{6d6 mental damage}.

gEADE2ZlQ0vRnps7.name: Stench
gEADE2ZlQ0vRnps7.description:
30 feet.

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as itʼs sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

nHTCIVLK6QSJqHd3.name: Poisonous Pustules
nHTCIVLK6QSJqHd3.description:
Requirements The hezrou is grappling a creature

Effect Toxic fluids spurt from burst boils and weeping wens on the hezrou's body. A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the hezrou takes [[/r {2d12+6}[poison]]]{2d12+6 poison damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true] save).

Hippocampus.name: Hippocampus
Hippocampus.publicNotes: Hippocampi serve as steeds for aquatic humanoids or roam wild in the sea.

LYeMRFsmLZRCk3uE.name: Sudden Retreat
LYeMRFsmLZRCk3uE.description: The hippocampus makes a tail Strike, then Swims with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its swim Speed. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement.

Hippogriff.name: Hippogriff
Hippogriff.publicNotes:
With the proud bearing of a great raptor and the magnificence of a powerful horse, hippogriffs are thought to be an accidental fusion of creatures or perhaps the creation of a flesh-warping wizard with a keen aesthetic sense. Regardless of their original source, these animals are now a common sight in the skies above their favored plains or hill country.

Hippogriffs bear the wings, forelegs, and head of a bird of prey, with feather coloration similar to that of a hawk or eagle, though some breeders have managed to produce specimens with stark-white or coal-black feathers. Their torso, hindquarters, and tail resemble those of a horse and usually are colored bay, chestnut, or gray, with some coats bearing black, pinto, or even palomino coloration.

Hippogriffs are similar in size to large horses. Much like their equine cousins, hippogriffs often have to keep wary eyes on the skies above them, as both are preferred meals for hungry griffons and wyverns. Only hippogriffs' superior speed helps protect them from these predators.

Hippogriffs are exceptionally territorial and fiercely protect the lands under their domain. They typically favor sweeping grasslands, rolling hills, and prairies. Exceptionally hardy hippogriffs make their homes nestled into niches on canyon walls, from which they comb the rocky deserts for coyotes, deer, and the occasional humanoid. Hippogriffs prefer mammalian prey, but they graze after every meal to aid in digestion.

Since hippogriff hunting habits can be dangerous to both ranchers and their livestock, such communities often set bounties on hippogriffs. As a result, preserved hippogriffs frequently decorate frontier taverns and remote outposts alongside the taxidermic remains of deer, elk, and bears.

However, other communities train hippogriffs from hatching to be ridden by elite soldiers in combat- the most notable among these groups in the Inner Sea region is the Sable Company Mercenaries in the city-state of Korvosa. Attempts are sometimes made to train adult hippogriffs in the same manner, but this often proves far more difficult. Hippogriff riders must use special saddles and combat techniques that allow them to act in concert with their mount, fighting effectively while avoiding interfering with the movement of their companion's wings.

NWD8KA0NNOrEyrvq.name: Flying Strafe
NWD8KA0NNOrEyrvq.description: The hippogriff Flies up to its fly speed and makes two talon Strikes at any point during that movement. Each Strike must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.

Hippopotamus.name: Hippopotamus
Hippopotamus.publicNotes: Typical adult hippos move quickly on land and attack stealthily in the water. Though herbivorous, hippos are notoriously aggressive and territorial.

m9kHAZ6q8lhsA9dC.name: Deep Breath
m9kHAZ6q8lhsA9dC.description: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.

oNpExBZGMP135Gh8.name: Capsize
oNpExBZGMP135Gh8.description: The hippopotamus tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The hippopotamus must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 25 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the hippo) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Hodag.name: Hodag
Hodag.publicNotes:
Because they are often described only in drunken retellings of loggers' or miners' tales, hodags are considered by many to exist only in the local folklore of remote areas. However, some individuals have actually encountered these dangerous beasts firsthand, and even fewer have lived to tell their tales.

Hodags are reptilian creatures the size of bulls. These vicious predators' long claws can tear creatures apart in seconds. Their backs sport dozens of long spines that run from their snouts all the way down the length of their powerful tails. Their wide mouths are full of sharp and twisted rows of teeth not unlike those of a shark. The hodags' rough, scaly hides carry hues of green and brown, allowing them to blend into their forest surroundings where they ambush prey. Only their glowing red eyes reveal their presence, though hodags have learned to use this to their advantage by drawing attention to their eyes in one area, then closing their eyes and stealthily moving to another area to cause their prey to misconstrue their location.

In the wintertime, when snow and ice blankets a region, hodags grow a foul-smelling coat of greasy, dark-brown fur that sprouts in tufts from between their scales. A typical hodag measures over 10 feet long from snout to tail and weighs upward of 700 pounds.

VzMnFSYbgzk4CXes.name: Trackless
VzMnFSYbgzk4CXes.description: A hodag sweeps the ground behind it with its tail as it moves, obscuring its tracks. The DCs of checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} a hodag are increased by 10.

Od1YX31hXRHCzHS3.name: Rip and Tear
Od1YX31hXRHCzHS3.description: The hodag makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

x3sRV0Fub8ixWfBV.name: Toss
x3sRV0Fub8ixWfBV.description:
The hodag Strides, then makes a Strike against a target in reach. If it moves at least 20 feet and succeeds at its Strike, the hodag deals damage normally and then attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC to toss the enemy into the air.

On a success, the tossed creature is thrown 10 feet in a straight line in the direction of the hodag's choice and then lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the creature is knocked into a solid object, it takes [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage} as well before landing prone. The hodag can instead toss a creature straight up in the air. The creature lands in the same square where it started, takes [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage}, and lands prone.

Hound Archon.name: Hound Archon
Hound Archon.publicNotes: Among the rank-and-file soldiers of Heaven's armies, few individuals are more dependable and truer to the cause than the noble hound archons, embodiments of the virtue of diligence. Unlike horned archons, who perform at a similar level along Heaven's grand hierarchy, hound archons do not scout ahead for evil or perform reconnaissance missions in hostile territory. A hound archon's role is as a soldier in the heart of battle or, occasionally, as a sentinel tasked with protecting a particular strategic location or holy site.
Hound Archon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

HsTNpm0qjSAwEMqC.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
HsTNpm0qjSAwEMqC.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

QItaAvzvKUUHn205.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

2SKe9OcSUJ5AXTPf.name: Archon's Door
2SKe9OcSUJ5AXTPf.description: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door}, the archon can use dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either creature used dimension door.

lWwRydUGrcy5WmZf.name: Change Shape
lWwRydUGrcy5WmZf.description:
A hound archon can take the appearance of any canid animal of Small to Large size. This doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for their Strikes, but if the canid's bite attack has the Knockdown ability, then the hound archon's bite attack gains that ability while they are in that form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

3mOfCebY1QT6qHAG.name: Diligent Assault
3mOfCebY1QT6qHAG.description: The hound archon carefully makes one greatsword Strike and one jaws Strike in any order. These attacks count toward the hound archon's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

Hound Of Tindalos.name: Hound Of Tindalos
Hound Of Tindalos.publicNotes:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

QTK9hewzSwMZUHHY.name: 隐形术(仅限自身) Invisibility (Self only)
QTK9hewzSwMZUHHY.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

RrDmY99gWZJtFtjo.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.name: Otherworldly Mind
u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.description: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a mental effect, that creature takes [[/r {4d6}[mental]]]{4d6 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:25|basic:true] save). On a critical failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.name: Ripping Gaze
1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.description:
30 feet.

The hound of Tindalos's eyes glow balefully, causing painful but bloodless wounds to rip open in the body of a creature that meets its awful gaze. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it takes [[/r {4d6}[slashing]]]{4d6 slashing damage} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save).

A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.description: When a hound of Tindalos is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90º (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.name: Angled Entry
xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.description:
The hound of Tindalos casts a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Dimension Door} spell, but it must transport itself into a space adjacent to an angle of 90º (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges.

Once per day, the hound can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.

Ice Golem.name: Ice Golem
Ice Golem.publicNotes:
Ice golems are either carved from massive blocks of ice, or pieced together from individual components that are then fused together through heat and refreezing. In most cases, the resulting shape is little more than a crude approximation of a humanoid form, but given the right talent, an ice golem could be an exquisitely carved statue of a mythical creature, famous persona, or even a deity.

While ice golems most frequently serve as guardians in freezing climates, the magic that holds an ice golem together keeps it from melting in warmer temperatures. This, combined with the fact that ice golems lie on the lower end of the scale as far as cost and difficulty to create, gives these constructs unusual features that puts them in great demand. The rich and powerful in hot, arid regions often commission ice golems not only as guardians for their estates and vaults, but for comfort-the presence of an ice golem standing quietly sentinel in the corner of a room can help to keep the chamber at a comfortable temperature. The truly decadent use ice golems as servants to keep drinks cold.

1LmOy2NMwi2RqSKT.name: Golem Antimagic
1LmOy2NMwi2RqSKT.description:
harmed by fire ([[/r 4d6]], [[/r 1d10]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by cold (area [[/r 1d6]] HP); slowed by water

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as “cold and water”), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

2svyNegNoV205Fbp.name: Icy Demise
2svyNegNoV205Fbp.description: When an ice golem is destroyed, its body explodes in a blast of frigid air and razor-sharp ice, dealing [[/r {2d6}[slashing]]]{2d6 slashing damage} and [[/r {2d6}[cold]]]{2d6 cold damage} to creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true] save.

CUl4eRbkbnzMJ2kZ.name: Vulnerable to Endure Elements
CUl4eRbkbnzMJ2kZ.description: An ice golem can be targeted with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.5esP2GVzvxWsMgaX]{Endure Elements} even if it's not willing. If it is targeted, for 1 round it can't use Breath Weapon or benefit from creeping cold, and its fist attack doesn't deal cold damage.

W3rITonxbyLEARlP.name: Breath Weapon
W3rITonxbyLEARlP.description:
The ice golem exhales a blast of freezing mist that deals [[/r {6d6}[cold]]]{6d6 cold damage} in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

dj9YzVTLAtPASMHB.name: Creeping Cold
dj9YzVTLAtPASMHB.description: When the ice golem gets a critical hit with a fist Strike, the target also takes [[/r {2d6}[persistent,cold]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Cold Damage} and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Ice Mephit.name: Ice Mephit
Ice Mephit.publicNotes: Though capable of the same depths of cruelty as their fire mephit kin, ice mephits carry theirs out in a more calculating way. Unlike most mephits, these pale blue mephits prefer solitude to company. Lacking in empathy, they are known for their callousness, and have a reputation for brutal honesty. They also have few moral qualms about acting selfishly and exploiting weakness for their own gain, should the chance arise.
Ice Mephit.hp: fast healing 2 (when touching ice or snow)

a29GFo7lbKhSTAYm.name: Fast Healing 2 (when touching ice or snow)

kFLwkDqwtyueOpyG.name: Breath Weapon
kFLwkDqwtyueOpyG.description:
The ice mephit breathes shards of ice in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals [[/r {1d6}[cold]]]{1d6 cold damage} and [[/r {1d6}[piercing]]]{1d6 piercing damage} to each creature within the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

The ice mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Ice Yai.name: Ice Yai
Ice Yai.publicNotes: Ice yai combine the brutality of frost giants with the grace of martial artists. More than any other oni, ice yai delight not in the pleasures of the flesh, but in flesh itself-rather than indulging in oft-destructive mortal vices like drink or lust, ice yai pursue physical perfection, reveling in the process of turning their bodies into powerful fighting machines.
Ice Yai.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

eXhIeUv9hE9Bnejj.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At will) (Self only)
eXhIeUv9hE9Bnejj.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

hwNl8SFYu6kOmwly.name: 高等黑暗视觉 Greater Darkvision

lhaBLbyRbWQceU9t.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

zZd6BogevnvvWpQx.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

eaXk793zko55RRmG.name: Icy Deflection
eaXk793zko55RRmG.description:
Trigger The ice yai is targeted by a ranged Strike or spell attack roll that doesn't have the fire trait

Effect The ice yai creates a reflective blockade of ice, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack roll. If the attack misses, the ice yai redirects the attack to another creature within 20 feet of the yai. The attacker rerolls the attack roll against the new target.

N4XGBKf3QWAL89KZ.name: Change Shape
N4XGBKf3QWAL89KZ.description:
The frost yai takes on the appearance of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.oSvWsqFnQLS5wlvg]{Frost Giant}. This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

CpDQG0xz9auLn9gr.name: Double Punch
CpDQG0xz9auLn9gr.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ice yai makes two fist Strikes.

oc2KzcT2MuHsRZ1k.name: Frozen Strike
oc2KzcT2MuHsRZ1k.description:
On a critical hit with a fist Strike or a hit with an ice missile Strike, the target creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 3} for 1 round.

Icewyrm.name: Icewyrm
Icewyrm.publicNotes: Resembling wingless, serpentine dragons formed of jagged ice and shot through with veins of nearly frozen water, these elementals dwell within icebergs and enjoy striking out at passing ships or creatures. They're especially common in frigid stretches of ocean in the Plane of Water, where icebergs cluster together into enormous islands of ice.

8UmPplmBw6ibPa9v.name: Explosion
8UmPplmBw6ibPa9v.description: When the icewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing [[/r {8d6}[cold]]]{8d6 cold damage} to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save).

UZc2Evb7hxJkfGtx.name: Breath Weapon
UZc2Evb7hxJkfGtx.description:
The icewyrm breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of freezing shards of razor-sharp ice, dealing [[/r {3d12}[cold]]]{3d12 cold damage} and [[/r {3d12}[piercing]]]{3d12 piercing damage} to every creature in the line (@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true] save).

The icewyrm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Jw8Rmo5ZFh9ouq86.name: Ice Burrow
Jw8Rmo5ZFh9ouq86.description: The Icewyrm can Burrow through ice or snow with a Speed of 20 feet. It moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Icicle Snake.name: Icicle Snake
Icicle Snake.publicNotes: Translucent and capable of hanging suspended and near motionless, icicle snakes sense the heat of living creatures as a threat and attempt to use their camouflage and chilling bite against foes.

M3YBIgGHTHFIcGRF.name: Icicle
M3YBIgGHTHFIcGRF.description: Until the next time it acts, the icicle snake appears to be an unassuming icicle. It has an automatic result of 27 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an icicle.

Ifrit Pyrochemist.name: Ifrit Pyrochemist
Ifrit Pyrochemist.publicNotes:
Ifrits' blood blazes with elemental fire. Most ifrits are second-class citizens who serve under the iron heel of the efreeti and their Dominion of Flame, but those born outside the efreet hierarchy or who choose to flee it live lives of passion in search of fame, glory, and power.

Ifrits are fond of fire, but this doesn't mean they all embrace fire's destructive nature. Those who seek more productive roles in a society find inspiration in the way flames flit and dance, and they pride themselves in their skills as acrobats or dancers. The church of Sarenrae particularly welcomes ifrit fire dancers, both in appreciation of their skill and to help ensure these ifrits have a safe place apart from their more violent kin.

But by and large, ifrits are drawn to professions and callings that allow them to wallow in the glories of fire. Ifrit pyrochemists apply this calling to alchemical teachings, seeing purity in every single bomb thrown or conflagration lit.

eRnSGx9tKMwZStVB.name: Lesser Alchemist's Fire
eRnSGx9tKMwZStVB.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, [[/r {1}[persistent,fire]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}, and 1 fire splash damage.

7FgPojTX7HEIApDW.name: Blank Formula Book
7FgPojTX7HEIApDW.description: A formula book holds the formulas necessary to make items other than the common equipment from this chapter; alchemists typically get one for free. Each formula book can hold the formulas for up to 100 different items. Formulas can also appear on parchment sheets, tablets, and almost any other medium; there's no need for you to copy them into a specific book as long as you can keep them on hand to reference them.

qZDyd8KGBqXEYFHU.name: Lesser Elixir of Life
qZDyd8KGBqXEYFHU.description:
Activate A Interact

Elixirs of life accelerate a living creatures natural healing processes and immune system. Upon drinking this elixir, you regain [[/r {3d6+6}[healing]]]{3d6+6 Hit Points} and gain +1 item bonus to saving throws against diseases and poisons for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.EpB7yJPEuG6ez4z3]{Effect: Lesser Elixir of Life}

eF4sqCqXrBkfqjib.name: Lesser Smokestick
eF4sqCqXrBkfqjib.description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.

nKqb3ksLlia2sFBZ.name: Infused Items
nKqb3ksLlia2sFBZ.description:
An ifrit pyrochemist carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time the pyrochemist makes their daily preparations:

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.yd3kEK21YknZLlcT]{Lesser Alchemist's Fire} (5)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Lesser Elixir of Life} (2)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Lesser Smokestick}

dFKXMQ8FbHDHNhTC.name: Quick Bomber
dFKXMQ8FbHDHNhTC.description: The ifrit pyrochemist draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

Iguanodon.name: Iguanodon
Iguanodon.publicNotes:
Iguanodons are large, herbivorous dinosaurs that inhabit swamps and forests where they browse on the abundant vegetation. The iguanodon is capable of moving on two feet or on four, quickly switching from one stance to the other depending on whether it needs to move through dense foliage or to reach delectable morsels hanging up in the canopy.

Although iguanodons are herbivores, they are notoriously quick to anger. Their thumb spikes make their claws particularly devastating weapons. A well-placed blow from one of these claws can turn a hungry predator into a cowering beast with one swift strike. Iguanodons are 30 feet long and weigh 6,000 pounds.

filzxUgupqvL1ZQq.name: Gouging Lunge
filzxUgupqvL1ZQq.description: The iguanodon makes a thumb spike Strike at an adjacent foe and then Strides up to 15 feet, dragging its thumb spike across the foe to gouge out a brutal wound. If this Strike hits, it deals an extra [[/r {1d8}[slashing]]]{1d8 points of slashing damage} and the following Stride does not trigger reactions from the creature struck. This thumb spike Strike counts as two attacks when calculating the iguanodon's multiple attack penalty.

Imentesh.name: Imentesh
Imentesh.publicNotes: The loquacious proteans known as imenteshes serve as missionaries, spies, and heralds of chaos to further the protean goal of reality's dissolution. Imenteshes are cunning, curiously diplomatic, and profoundly whimsical. They travel beyond the Maelstrom for their work, frequently adopting extravagant personal attire and decorations that often border upon the garish, all to curry favor with less chaotic beings.
Imentesh.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

4TTBHqodJtZulkHb.name: 神圣狂怒(混乱) Divine Wrath (Chaotic)
4TTBHqodJtZulkHb.description:
你引导你的神祇的怒火，攻击对立阵营的敌人。选择一个你的神祇具有的阵营。（混乱，邪恶，善良，或者秩序）。如果你没有神祇，或者你的神祇是绝对中立，你无法施放该法术。该法术具有你选择的阵营的特征。你造成你所选阵营类型的4d10伤害；每个区域中的生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免。对应你所选阵营的生物不受影响。既不对应也不对立的生物将其豁免骰结果视为更好一级。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物承受一半伤害。

失败 该生物承受完整伤害，并且 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

大失败 该生物承受全部伤害，并且 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}; 当其恶心时，也会 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

升阶 (+1) 该伤害增加1d10。

RM8PNh1GNliHv6hz.name: 巧言术(恒定法术) Tongues (Constant)
RM8PNh1GNliHv6hz.description:
无论什么语言，目标都可以理解其所有的词语，并且向其他生物用该语言交流。当处于一群各异的生物中时，每次目标将要说话，他可以选择一个生物，并使用一种该生物理解的语言来讲述，即使该目标不知道这语言具体是什么。

升阶 (7环级) 持续时间为8小时。

4rEcF7higflYgkOC.name: 次元门(随意施法) Dimension Door (At will)
4rEcF7higflYgkOC.description:
你通过开启一扇绕过通常空间的门，将自身以及任何你穿戴和持握的物品从你当前所在的空间立刻传送到你能看见的范围内的开阔空间。如果此时另一个生物会与你随行—即使你使用异次元存储空间—你会失去该法术。

升阶 (5环级) 该射程增加到1英里。你无须看见你的目标，只要你曾经去过那里，并且了解其与你的相对位置和距离。你会暂时免疫1小时。

y7xDGYy2BAsv28Gu.name: 行动自如(恒定法术) Freedom of Movement (Constant)
y7xDGYy2BAsv28Gu.description: 你驱散可能会阻碍一个生物或者令其移动减慢的效果。当处于该法术效果中时，法术目标忽视会赋予其速度环境减值的效果。当法术目标尝试 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape} 一个令其 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{擒抱 Grabbed}或 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{束缚 Restrained}的效果时，它自动成功，除非该效果是魔法性的，并且其环级比行动自如更高。

nv8kWBvEcv3diNEd.name: 侦测阵营(随意施法,仅限守序) Detect Alignment (At will) (Lawful only)
nv8kWBvEcv3diNEd.description:
当你感受到阵营灵光时，视野中会闪动光芒。选择混乱，邪恶，善良或者秩序。你侦测该阵营的灵光。你不会获得存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择不侦测你知晓已经有该阵营的生物或者效果。

只有6或者更高等级的生物具有阵营灵光——除非是神术施法者，不死生物，或者外层位面（Outer Sphere的存在）。

升阶 (2环级) 你能了解到各个灵光的位置和强度。

4fUKQrOX75rYdFV8.name: Entropy Sense
4fUKQrOX75rYdFV8.description: An imentesh can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the imentesh the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} or that is otherwise shielded from divination and prediction cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

KTc5frqwQnvcjRY9.name: 在所有对魔法的豁免上获得+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

UVvsMOpzGvjOBeG1.name: Protean Anatomy 15
UVvsMOpzGvjOBeG1.description:
An imentesh's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the imentesh takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The imentesh is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the imentesh automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

XaAIKVkn76K7fFFS.name: Change Shape
XaAIKVkn76K7fFFS.description:
The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

IukwgU6DfXFrQy49.name: Inflict Warpwave
IukwgU6DfXFrQy49.description: An imentesh inflicts a warpwave on a creature within 100 feet @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save to resist).

dEiJsJoECS4hvDnB.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
dEiJsJoECS4hvDnB.description:
An imentesh's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed targets.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

9FcMZnkENPj4z3q0.name: Warpwave Strike
9FcMZnkENPj4z3q0.description: Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or be subject to a warpwave.

uDrkrfwjoPByW5Zs.name: 扭曲波 Warpwaves
uDrkrfwjoPByW5Zs.description:
Many proteans can subject their foes to disorienting alterations perceived in time and space by creating ripples of unstable reality in the environment called warpwaves.

When a creature fails its saving throw and is affected by a warpwave, roll [[/r 1d8]] and consult the table below for the specific effect on that creature.

Unless indicated otherwise, a warpwave effect lasts for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and a new warpwave effect negates any previous warpwave effect already affecting a creature.

d8 Warpwave Effect
1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} on a critical failure)
2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and gains [[/r 4d6 #Temporary Hit Points]]{4d6 temporary Hit Points}
3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (permanent on a critical failure)
4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical failure)
5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by filaments of energy
6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} (Stride, Strike, or Step only)
7 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}
8 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure)

Intellect Devourer.name: Intellect Devourer
Intellect Devourer.publicNotes: Intellect devourers serve as advance scouts and infiltrators for the powerful force of alien beings called the Dominion of the Black. These monsters roam the Darklands, from which they mount secret invasions of the world above. When an intellect devourer infiltrates a society, its first priority is to acquire a body. It might first seek out a graveyard for a fresh corpse, as this is easier than fighting and killing someone. When the aberration compresses itself into the host's brain cavity, its real body goes dull to sensation as it connects to the nervous system of its host. If found out, an intellect devourer might quickly inhabit a new body to make its escape, preferably something inconspicuous such as a domestic animal.

2q5Hz0vUEER1aViF.name: 隐形术(随意施法,仅限自身) Invisibility (At Will) (Self Only)
2q5Hz0vUEER1aViF.description:
目标被幻术包复，变得 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}. 这令该生物对所有生物 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪Undetected} ，但生物可以尝试寻找目标，令其改为 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}。如果目标使用敌对动作，法术在敌对动作完成后结束。

升阶 (4环级) 该法术持续1分钟，但目标使用敌对动作时该法术不会结束。

1RcuxgvvscX2wpNJ.name: 狂乱偏执(随意施法) Paranoia (At Will)
1RcuxgvvscX2wpNJ.description:
你令目标将所有其他生物视为严重威胁。目标陷入对周围所有生物的严重偏执中，并必须尝试一次意志豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标相信其周围所有人都是潜在威胁。它对所有不处于敌对的生物均 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{不友好 Unfriendly}，即使本来是盟友。他不对任何人视为盟友。该法术在1轮后结束。

失败 如同成功，但是该效果持续1分钟。

大失败 如同失败，除了目标相信它眼中所有人都是不共戴天之仇敌。它会使用其反应动作和自由动作对付每个人，无论本来是否为盟友，这由GM决定。除此之外，它会如通常一般理智行动，相对于不理他的生物，他会倾向攻击和妨碍主动攻击它的生物。

升阶 (6环级) 你能以至多5个生物为目标。

Sv1f9lzuigDrIgpC.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
Sv1f9lzuigDrIgpC.description:
你发出一股标记魔法存在的脉冲。你不会获得魔法存在或不存在以外的任何信息。你可以选择忽略你完全知晓的魔法，例如你或者你盟友的魔法物品以及持续法术。

仅当幻术魔法的环级低于你的侦测魔法环级时，你才能侦测幻术魔法。但是，具有幻术灵光但是没有在外表上做伪装的物品（例如一瓶隐形术药水），通常能够正常侦测。

升阶 (3环级) 你会了解法术侦测区域中最高环级的效果的学派。如果有相同强度的多个效果，GM决定你了解的为哪一个。

升阶 (4环级) 如3环级，你也能指出最高环级魔法的来源。如同一种模糊感官（imprecise sense），你不会了解具体的位置，但是可以将来源锁定到5尺立方（或者最近的那个五尺立方，如果来源体积比这个区域更大）。

dYvQOwzgoNuS9cG8.name: Body Thief
dYvQOwzgoNuS9cG8.description:
The intellect devourer reduces in size and burrows into the brain of a creature dead for no longer than 1 day. At the start of the intellect devourer's next turn, the body revives at its maximum Hit Points, controlled by the devourer. The intellect devourer is conscious and can sense everything the possessed body could.

Any effect that ends the possession kills the host body with the same effects as Exit Body. The intellect devourer can't use any of the host creature's spells with Body Thief but can use its own spells.

The host body slowly decays while inhabited by the intellect devourer, becoming uninhabitable after 7 days unless preserved with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.xRgU9rrhmGAgG4Rc]{Gentle Repose} or a similar effect.

GCGNJYiHP5GMdDAQ.name: Exit Body
GCGNJYiHP5GMdDAQ.description:
Requirements The intellect devourer is controlling a body with Body Thief

Effect The intellect devourer leaves its host body, which dies instantly and is no longer a suitable host for any Body Thief ability. The intellect devourer appears at full size in an adjacent space.

pHckdhGspQesS1nl.name: Ravage
pHckdhGspQesS1nl.description:
The intellect devourer makes two talon Strikes against a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature, using the same attack modifier as its highest attack modifier.

These Strikes gain the death trait. If Ravage kills the target, the intellect devourer may use Body Thief against it as a free action.

wHsOiFn1P7QcaaJ2.name: Stolen Identity
wHsOiFn1P7QcaaJ2.description: While an intellect devourer uses Body Thief, it gains the ability to understand and speak all languages known by the host, as well as knowledge of the host body's abilities, identity, role in society, and personality. However, it does not gain the specific memories or knowledge of the host body.

Invidiak.name: Invidiak
